Subject: You Need to Publish Bad Videos. Here's Why.
Body:

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

P.S. If you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator
Hooks Pro​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/48hvhehmr3qrkeax/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
).

******************
Retirement Warning
******************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/wnh2hghqwdvw82a7/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1EVTh3V0ZXTFVOYw==
)
Title: Don't Retire Until You Hit These 5 Goals

Framework: Don't (Activity) Until You Hit These 5 Goals

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/reh8hohm0pv0ngh2/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +313

Why this works:

Warning - Warnings like this do a great job of grabbing the
audience's attention.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you want to know what
these goals are.

List - The list of 5 goals adds to the curiosity and makes this
video more tangible.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience to not do
something they want to do until they've hit some goals.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Don't Buy A House In Nashville Until You've Checked These 3
Things
* Don't Hire a Lawyer Until You've Asked These 5 Questions

*******************
French Fundamentals
*******************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/08hwh9h2d4wdqlhl/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj10MW5sNFczUW9YZw==
)
Title: What actually WORKED to Learn FRENCH (No Apps, No Hacks)

Framework: What actually WORKED to [Achieve goal] (No [Common,
but unwanted solutions])

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/reh8hohm0pv0ngh2/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +368

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience would love to know what will
actually work to help them learn French.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you wonder what it is
that actually worked.

Refute Objection - Many people who've tried to learn French are
sick of apps and hacks, so this title refutes that objection
with, "(No Apps, No Hacks)."

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience what will
actually work to help them achieve a goal without the things they
don't want.

Examples of this framework in action:

* What actually WORKED to Hit 100K Subs (No Bots, No Cringe)
* What actually WORKED to Read The Bible Every Day (No Apps, No
Hacks)

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/48hvhehmr3qrkeax/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
)

****************
All The Benefits
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/vqh3hrhop63p86tg/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1HRjZ2bXM2d1NtWQ==
)
Title: This Meal Prep Has 70g of Protein and Tastes Like a Cheat
Meal

Framework: This (Entity) Has (Benefits)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/reh8hohm0pv0ngh2/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +575

Why this works:

Desire - This lists out two benefits:

* 70g of Protein
* Tastes like a cheat mea

Curiosity - By not mentioning what the meal actually is, it opens
a loop and makes you want to click even more.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about
something that has a few benefits, but don't specify what it is.

Examples of this framework in action:

* This Flight Hack Saves $800 Per Trip and Feels Like Cheating
the System​

* This Foundation Has SPF 50 and Looks Like Your Natural Skin

***********
Toxic Types
***********

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/l2hehmhl3pv3wgi6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1MMktyWnhPOXZ0MA==
)
Title: God’s Warning: 7 Types of People You Must Not Help

Framework: (Authority Figure’s) Warning: 7 Types of (Entities)
You Must Not (Activity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/reh8hohm0pv0ngh2/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +619

Why this works:

Authority - Dropping in an authority figure in the beginning
lends credibility to your video.

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Negativity - This leverages negativity two different ways:

* It's a warning
* It's about people you should not help

How you can use this framework: Give your audience a warning
about things they should not do.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Warren Buffett's Warning: 7 Types of Stocks You Must Not Buy​

* Mayo Clinic Warning: 7 Sick Symptoms You Must Not Ignore

**************
Bored Blessing
**************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/m2h7h5h38x082ksm/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1vclFLZklYTWlBOA==
)
Title: You Need to Be Bored. Here's Why.

Framework: You Need to Be (Bad state or action). Here’s Why.

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/reh8hohm0pv0ngh2/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +2782

Why this works:

Curiosity - Counterintuitive statements like this do a great job
of building curiosity and getting people to click.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that they need
to be or do something they don't necessarily want to do.

Examples of this framework in action:

* You Need to Argue With Your Spouse. Here's Why.
* You Need to Listen to Bad Music. Here's Why.

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hng8x4gt6h9k8e444cnhr0ggr/e0hph7h70zw0mli8/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj15MnNrVHptLVp3WQ==
)
Title: This Can Make or Break Your Retirement

Hook score: -87

Why this flopped: The wording in this title is a little weak.

It's a cliche, it doesn't take a side, and there's no strong
opinion. I think it might've done better if it were about either
making retirement or breaking retirement, but not "make or
break." Here are some examples of what I mean:

Making retirement:

"5 Things That Will Make Retirement EASY"

"99% Of People Don't Know The Secret To A Great Retirement"

Breaking retirement:

"5 Things That Will Ruin Your Retirement"

"99% Of People Are Accidentally Making This Retirement Mistake"

These two sets of titles take a bolder stance and avoid clichés.

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

If you know a fellow creator who needs help with writing better
titles, share your referral link below with them.

- Jake

))

Subject: Don't Post A SINGLE YouTube Video Until You Read This
Body:
​Read online (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/p8heh9h4zmor7waq/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2RvbnQtcG9zdC1hLXNpbmdsZS15b3V0dWJlLXZpZGVvLXVudGlsLXlvdS1yZWFkLXRoaXMv

)​

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

P.S. If you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator
Hooks Pro​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/owhkhqhwrpdx8zcv/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
).

**************
Major Mistakes
**************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/x0hph6hewo0knpf5/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj00MWkyWElWOG1DSQ==
)
Title: Every Major Human Mistake That Changed History Forever

Framework: Every Major (Negative Event) That Changed (Entity)
Forever

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/58hvh7hgmq235zu6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +563

Why this works:

Epic - There are two phrases that make this video feel epic:

* The word "Every"
* "Changed History Forever"

Negativity - People love dramatic topics like this.

Curiosity - The word "change" is powerful for building curiosity
because it makes you want to know what happened.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about every
major negative event that changed history forever.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Every NBA Draft Mistake That Changed The League Forever
* Every Major Adult Decision That Will Change Your Life Forever

************
Weird Winter
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/g3hnh5hm3rwge3cr/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1oUllTZFlGeU1ydw==
)
Title: This Winter Is Looking VERY Weird…

Framework: (Upcoming entity) Is Looking VERY Weird...

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/58hvh7hgmq235zu6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +661

Why this works:

Curiosity - This title builds curiosity in two ways:

* It's about the future, and since the future is unknown, it's a
naturally curiosity-filled topic.
* The word "weird" also sparks curiosity because it means this
video is about something different than normal, and people want
to know what's different about it.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that something
in the future is looking very weird.

Examples of this framework in action:

* This Q4 Is Looking Very Weird For Ecommerce Businesses...
* This Next Wave of AI Tools is Looking VERY Weird…

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/owhkhqhwrpdx8zcv/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
)

).

)

​

************
Field Tested
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/wnh2hghqwn6mrmu7/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj0zUll6WjRGQ1dxSQ==
)
Title: I built one website 20 times— to find the BEST website
builder

Framework: I (Activity) 20 times— to find the BEST (Tool)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/58hvh7hgmq235zu6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +768

Why this works:

Credibility - This title builds trust because it's not just an
opinion of some website builders, he's showing proof that he put
in a lot of effort to find the truth.

Desire - This creator's audience wants to know about the best
website builder.

How you can use this framework: Do one thing many times using
different tools to find the best one.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I cooked steak 7 different ways — to find the BEST tasting way
* I took one picture 20 times— to find the BEST nature
photography settings

*************
Bait & Switch
*************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/l2hehmhl3e7qomf6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1hbmwtSmZGTlk2cw==
)
Title: They Promised to Make Social Security Tax-Free — But
Here’s What They’re Doing Instead

Framework: They Promised to (Benefit)— But Here’s What They’re
Doing Instead

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/58hvh7hgmq235zu6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +840

Why this works:

Negativity - Talking about what "They" promised to do, but aren't
doing, is a great way to give your title a feeling of drama and
conspiracy, which is intoxicating to many viewers.

Curiosity - "But Here’s What They’re Doing Instead" opens a loop
so you have to click to find out what they're doing.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about how
"they" promised to do something good, but are doing something
else instead.

Examples of this framework in action:

* They Promised to Make Electrical Vehicles Environmentally
Friendly — But Here’s What They’re Doing Instead
* They Promised I Would Love Visiting Paris — But Here’s What
Really Happened

******************
Marshalls Mistakes
******************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/z2hghnhe3nx539ap/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1acGJueU1JLXUxZw==
)
Title: Don’t Buy a SINGLE Thing at Marshalls Until You Watch
This!

Framework: Don’t (Activity) a SINGLE (Entity) at (Place) Until
You Watch This!

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/58hvh7hgmq235zu6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1200

Why this works:

Negativity - Warnings with urgency like this do a great job of
grabbing the audience's attention and getting them to click.

The word "SINGLE" also does a few things: it makes this title
feel more focused, intense and confident.

How you can use this framework: Warn your audience to not do a
single thing somewhere until you watch this.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Don’t Post a SINGLE Instagram Reel Until You Watch This!
* Don’t Look at a SINGLE House in Orlando Until You Watch This!

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/68umz80m40f8h5lozx6hohpl5rkkkh9hgpddg/kkhmh6hnlrvzl2il/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1fLUVGbHgwcUpsMA==
)
Title: Are You Feeling Broke? How to Build Real Financial
Security

Hook score: -80

Why this flopped: Here's my hot take: You should never ask a
question in your title.

Yes, they can work occasionally, but for the most part, you're
better off making a bold statement.

Here are some ways we could rewrite this title:

"How to Build Real Financial Security (Even If You Feel Broke)"

"If You Feel Broke, Do THIS to Build Real Financial Security"

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

): +440

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience would love to make money fast.

Speed - People love speed and "as FAST as Possible" promises that
here.

Extreme & Epic- "as FAST as Possible" sounds more exciting than
just "Fast."

How you can use this framework: Ask ChatGPT to do something (or
take on another challenge) as fast as possible.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I Asked ChatGPT to Help Me Lose 15 Pounds as FAST as Possible
* I Tried To Get 100K YouTube Subscribers as FAST as Possible

secret in two ways:

* "SECRET Weapon" obviously makes you feel like you're getting in
on a secret.
* "(It's Not What You Think)" reinforces that feeling.

Negativity & Desire - This is all about a problem and solution:
having a mold-free home.

secret weapon to a problem-free thing.

hygiene do a great job of grabbing people's attention.

)
Title: Scrub Daddy all that? Let's find out!

Hook score: -70

Why this flopped: This title feels a little too clever and
clunky.

I think, "all that," specifically, is too unclear, so here's how
we might reword it:

"These Sponges Are BETTER Than The Scrub Daddy"

This is more clear and states a bold opinion.

But let's say that the title I wrote above still doesn't work.
What then?

Well, it's possible "Scrub Daddy" isn't the best subject to focus
the title on. Here are some other options:

"Everything You Need To Know About Cleaning Sponges"

"I Tested The Top Cleaning Sponges - Here’s The Best One"

"This Changes Everything I Thought I Knew About Sponges"

Title: Gore-Tex Sued for Lying to their Customers

Why this flopped: This is some spicy drama, which people normally

It's a slight, but significant difference that can have a big
impact on views.

Here are some questions to avoid a flop like this:

* Does this match why my audience watches my channel?
* Has this topic done well for my channel (or at least my
competitors) before?
* Is this topic something my target audience is interested in?

(

Title: I Investigated The GREEDIEST Things In Video Games

Framework: I Investigated The GREEDIEST Things In (Niche)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehprek0msxh6pzw777i5hwg44w/p8heh9h4964mn2iq/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +409

Why this works:

Negativity - Controversy and drama, like "greediest" here, grabs
attention and makes for an interesting video.

Extreme - The fact that this video is about the greediest things,
and not just regular greedy things, makes this more extreme and
interesting.

How you can use this framework: Investigate the greediest (or
other similarly controversial) things in your niche.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I Investigated The GREEDIEST Companies In America
* I Investigated The DEADLIEST Sports In The World

): +625

Why this works:

Curiosity - This leverages curiosity in two ways:

* "Change Forever" opens a loop and makes you want to know what
changed and how.
* "(and nobody even realises)" makes you feel like you're getting
in on a secret.

Epic - "Change Forever" also makes this video feel epic.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about
something in your niche that's about to change forever, but they
don't even realize.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Electric Vehicles Are About to Change Forever (and nobody even
realises)

nobody even realises)

)
Title: The Day the World Changed FOREVER - Hiroshima: Minute by
Minute

Framework: The Day (Entity) Changed FOREVER - (Entity): Minute by
Minute

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehprek0msxh6pzw777i5hwg44w/p8heh9h4964mn2iq/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1223

Why this works:

Negativity - People can't get enough of dramatic events like
this.

Specific - This is specific in two ways:

* It's about a single day.
* It goes through that day minute by minute.

Many people think being vague in your titles builds curiosity and
makes people want to watch your video, and it can, but talking
about specific details like this often does a great job of
building curiosity and interest, too.

Epic - Like in the social media video above, "Changed Forever"
makes this video feel epic.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about a moment
that changed something forever.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The Game That Shocked the World FOREVER - Miracle on Ice:
Minute by Minute​

* The Trade That Broke Wall Street FOREVER - Black Monday​

)
Title: 99% Of People STILL Don't Know The Basics Of Prompting
(ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude)

or niche)

): +1455

Why this works:

Beginner - Making videos for beginners, in this case, talking
about "the basics," is a great way to attract a large audience
that's eager to learn.

Desire - This creator's audience is into prompting tips.

Curiosity - Talking about things "99% Of People STILL Don't Know"
gives you a little FOMO and makes you feel like you're getting in
on a secret.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about
something 99% of people still don't know the basics of.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 99% Of Lifters STILL Don't Know The Basics Of Squatting
* 99% Of People STILL Don't Know The Basics Of Growing Tomatoes

Title: How to Be So Productive It Feels ILLEGAL (No Motivation
Needed)

Framework: How to Be So [Desirable attribute] It Feels ILLEGAL
(No [Typically necessary, but unwanted thing] Needed)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehprek0msxh6pzw777i5hwg44w/p8heh9h4964mn2iq/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1524

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience wants to be more productive.

Controversy - Adding "It Feels ILLEGAL" brings some spice and
controversy, and makes this video feel more interesting.

Refute Objection - Most people think you need to be motivated to
be productive, but this title gets rid of that assumption with
"(No Motivation Needed)."

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how to be so
good at something it feels illegal. Then, at the end, drop in
that whatever they think they have to do to achieve that goal,
but don't want to do, your video makes it not necessary.

Examples of this framework in action:

* How to Hit A Golf Ball So Far It Feels ILLEGAL (No Super
Strength Needed)
* How to Learn Spanish So Fast It Feels Like Cheating (No
Memorization Needed)

Title: 20 SECRETS In Video Games

Hook score: -81

Why this flopped: This title seems pretty good — it's a list
about secrets. So what happened?

My theory is that it's not specific enough.

What are the secrets about? What are the consequences of these
secrets? For what game? Who should watch this video?

Here are some ways we could answer these questions for more
tangible, interesting titles:

"20 Secret Cheat Codes In Video Games"

"20 Secret Easter Eggs In Video Games"

"20 Mario Kart Secrets You've Never Seen"

"20 Secrets Every Adult Gamer Needs To See"

"20 Secrets That Prove Game Developers Are Amazing Humans"

)
Title: Cars Dealers Can’t Sell (August 2025) | It’s Getting Worse
RIGHT NOW

Framework: [Entities] [Authority Figures] Can’t [Action]
([Current Month] | It’s Getting Worse RIGHT NOW

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkwgne0i7hn6z5zxxi8h6l226/e0hph7h7k0er27i8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +367

Why this works:

Timeliness - This works so well because it's news about what's
going on right now. I love when channels have a repeatable format
like this they can use every month and bank on it getting lots of
views.

Negativity - Drama like this does a great job of grabbing
people's attention and interest.

Curiosity - This also opens a loop and makes you wonder what cars
are on this list.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about things
that authority figures or providers can't do right now.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Destinations Airlines Can't Book (August 2025) | It's Getting
Worse RIGHT NOW
* Popular Stocks I Would Never Buy (August 2025) | The Hype Is
Bad

************
Shirt Savers
************

(

)
Title: Don’t Throw It Away! Here’s How to Save Clothes That Got
Too Tight✅

(Unsalvagable things)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkwgne0i7hn6z5zxxi8h6l226/e0hph7h7k0er27i8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +506

Why this works:

Negativity - This starts with a warning to grab your attention.

Curiosity - This is counterintuitive because you'd think clothes
that are too tight can't be saved.

Desire - This audience would love to save clothes that don't fit
anymore.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience to stop doing
something they're likely doing and how to save something that's
normally unsalvageable.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Don't Throw Them Away! Here's How to Save Plants That Look Dead
* Don't Throw It Away! Here's How to Save Food That's Going Bad

Title: Top 10 1960s Protest Songs That Still Resonate Today

(Action) Today

​Hook score (

): +1098

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about), and they add some curiosity.

Curiosity - There's contrast between "1960s Songs" and "Still
Resonate Today".

Nostalgia - Nostalgia works great for many niches.

Negativity - "Protest Songs" brings some controversy and spice to
this video.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about
controversial things that used to be relevant a while ago, but
are still relevant today.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Top 10 1920s Fashion Trends That Still Look Great Today
* Top 10 1950s Health Habits That Still Keep You Healthy Today

): +1296

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about), and they add some curiosity.

Specific Audience - By calling out a specific audience ("People
Starting Over"), this makes this video feel like it was made for
them, so they're more likely to click.

Desire - People starting over are likely eager to learn about the
best jobs for themselves.

Negativity - People starting over are often struggling, and
making videos for people who are struggling is an excellent
strategy because they're often open to learning and change.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the best
things for people who are struggling.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 7 Best Cities for Newly Single Women
* 7 Best Businesses For Beginning Entrepreneurs

know it

): +8695

Why this works:

Negativity - Drama and controversy like this do a great job of
grabbing attention.

Timeliness - This drops in the current year to let you know this
is relevant right now.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you wonder what's going
to happen to our world.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that now is
the end of something.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 2026: The end of driving as we know it | Elon Musk
* 2026: The end of schools as we know them

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkwgne0i7hn6z5zxxi8h6l226/reh8hohmq07653b2/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1hWm9oQXJZQjBBOA==
)
Title: Why Automakers Can’t Move Factories Overnight

Hook score: -73

Why this flopped: If you want to build curiosity in your titles,
you need to spark a question in your audience's mind that they
want answers to.

This title might spark a question, but you don't need to watch
the video because the answer is obvious. Of course Automarkers
can't move factories overnight! That sounds way too difficult.

This video is about tariffs, and it might've done better if it
focused on the problems buyers and manufacturers are facing,
rather than asking an obvious question.

Maybe something like, "The REAL Problem With Manufacturing Cars
In The U.S." or "Tariffs Will Change The Way We Buy Cars
Forever".

Title: Dallas Texas Suburbs No One Talks About...But Should!

Framework: (Entities) No One Talks About...But Should!

​Hook score (

): +418

Why this works:

Curiosity - This leverages curiosity in two ways:

* It kinda makes you feel like you're getting in on a secret
about cool Dallas suburbs.
* It opens a loop and makes you want to know what these Texas
suburbs are about.

FOMO - "No One Talks About" not only builds curiosity, but also
gives you a bit of FOMO about these suburbs.

Desire - This creator's audience is into cool Dallas suburbs.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about things
no one talks about, but should.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Cryptocurrencies No One Talks About...But Should!
* National Parks No One Talks About...But Should!

**********

): +419

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about), and they add some curiosity.

Curiosity - It's counterintuitive that common weeds would
actually be expensive superfoods.

Desire - This creator's audience would love to find expensive
superfoods in their yard.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about), and they add some curiosity.

Curiosity - "Subtle Signs" and "Most Parents Miss" build
curiosity because it feels like you're getting in on some secret
insider knowledge.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about subtle

(

): +1145

Why this works:

Curiosity - This builds curiosity because it's about change, but
it doesn't specify what will change or how it will change.

Desire - The thumbnail and tone of this title hint that the
change is something awesome.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about how an
action completely changes something for your audience.

Examples of this framework in action:

* How Composting Completely Changes Your Garden Soil

Tricky Tax
**********

)
Title: 95% Tax on Inherited IRAs and How to AVOID it!

Framework: (Problem) and How to AVOID it!

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/p9ug0rngonh9h2zlv8rfqhpv02033hrhk4rrk/qvh8h7hd875zlzcl/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +2106

Why this works:

Negativity - Videos about avoiding big problems like this do a
great job of grabbing attention.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about how to
avoid a big problem.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 50% Muscle Loss After 50 and How to AVOID it!
* 75% of Studying Forgotten Within 24 Hours and How to AVOID it!

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/p9ug0rngonh9h2zlv8rfqhpv02033hrhk4rrk/reh8hohmq2r4ooh2/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1VMjBlZDU1NHNwOA==
)
Title: Why Your Body FEELS 10 Years Older Than It Is (And how to
fix it)

Hook score: -98

Why this flopped: I’m not sure of one particular reason this
flopped, but here are some ideas:

* Most of the successful videos are about certain exercises, so a
title like, “Do These Exercises Every Morning To Stop Feeling
Stiff,” might’ve been a better approach.
* It might’ve been more effective and clear to say “Why You’re 40
But FEEL 50 (And how to fix it)”. That states the “feel 10 years
older” in more easier-to-read terms. Of course, it also narrows
the audience, so that would depend on the channel’s audience
whether or not it makes sense to narrow the focus.
* It also might’ve been more effective if the title were more
focused on a specific pain, like “Why Your Back Hurts Every
Morning (And how to fix it)”.

In summary, know why people watch your channel and deliver on
that, and use simple, visual language in your titles.

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

titles, share your referral link below with them.

Subject: NEVER Do This in Your YouTube Titles (or You’re DONE)
Body:
​Read online (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/g3hnh5hmz8p52efr/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL25ldmVyLWRvLXRoaXMtaW4teW91ci15b3V0dWJlLXRpdGxlcy1vci15b3VyZS1kb25lLw==
) | Signup (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/3ohphkh3d5zl83sr/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tLw==
)​

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

P.S. If you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator
Hooks Pro​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/8ghqhoho569v8dsk/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
).

************************
The Unchangeable Changes
************************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/m2h7h5h3n6epx6sm/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1fRUowTGxCMzVkcw==
)
Title: Why Earth’s Rotation Speed is Changing

Framework: Why (Unchanging thing) is Changing

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/e0hph7h7n34gzrf8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +312

Why this works:

Curiosity - This builds curiosity in two ways:

* It's counterintuitive because most of us would assume Earth's
rotation speed would never change.
* It opens a loop because it doesn't specify how it's changing or
what the effects of it are.

Also, "Change" is just one of those topics that humans are wired
to pay attention to. Back in the caveman days, changes in our
environment could have meant life or death, so we needed to
notice them.

How you can use this framework: Explain why something that
seemingly shouldn't change is changing.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Why Stable Jobs Are Collapsing
* Why Traditional Investment Strategies Don't Work Anymore​

*****************
5 Minutes to Foxy
*****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/owhkhqhw8moveehv/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj11MzZQX3o2NGk0TQ==
)
Title: 5-Minute No Foundation Makeup With Just 5 Products | Quick
& Easy Everyday Look

Framework: 5-Minute No (Typical, but unwanted tactic) (Activity)
With (Constraint) | Quick & Easy (Entity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/e0hph7h7n34gzrf8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +920

Why this works:

Time Frame - The time frame of 5 minutes makes this more tangible
and desirable.

Constraint - The constraints of this makeup only requiring 5
products, not requiring any foundation, and only taking 5
minutes, make it more interesting and appealing.

List - The list of 5 products adds curiosity because you want to
know what they are.

Refute Objection - If you don't like foundation, this title gets
rid of that objection by promising you don't need it.

Desire - This creator's audience is into makeup, and "Quick &
Easy" adds to the desire.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about
something they're into that's short, only requires a few things,
and doesn't require something they'd expect it to require, but
don't want it to.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 10-Minute No-Equipment Workout With Just 4 Moves | Quick & Easy
Home Routine
* 5-Minute No-Bake Dessert With Just 4 Items | Quick & Easy Sweet
Treat​

************************************

ebook.

You'll see:

)

).​

​

***************
Perfect Parking
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/p8heh9h47wx0vktq/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1oZmxYeEJqODZDWQ==
)
Title: This One Parking Trick Works EVERY Time.

Framework: This One (Activity) Trick Works EVERY Time.

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/e0hph7h7n34gzrf8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +2152

Why this works:

Constraint - The fact that this is about just one trick makes you
more interested in the trick and increases the value of it. It
also makes for an easier decision to watch this video — you just
need to learn about one trick to help your parking, not a list of
20.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you wonder what the trick
is.

Desire - This creator's audience is into parking tricks.

Absolute - Words like "Every", "Any", "Always", and "Never" often
work great on YouTube because people are drawn to strong, bold
opinions.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about one
trick that works every time.

Examples of this framework in action:

* This One Guitar Trick Sounds Great EVERY Time.
* This One Golf Swing Trick Works EVERY Time.

**************
Skinny Secrets
**************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/x0hph6he7v36grh5/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1saXg0ZGVTX3NhWQ==
)
Title: This Walking Secret Melts Belly Fat After 50 (No Hard
Cardio)

Framework: This [Easy activity] Secret [Achieves big goal]
[Specific Audience] (No [Unwanted, but typically necessary
activity])

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/e0hph7h7n34gzrf8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +2550

Why this works:

Desire - This leverages desire in two ways:

* Most people would love to melt belly fat.
* Doing something easy like walking to melt belly fat sounds
incredible.

Curiosity - Making videos about secrets is a simple, but
effective way to build curiosity.

Specific Audience - When you call out a specific audience, like
"After 50", it makes them feel like your video was made
specifically for them, and they're more likely to click.

Refute Objection - Many people don't want to do hard cardio to
lose weight, but this title gets rid of that objection by
promising "No Hard Cardio."

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about a simple
activity secret that can help a specific group achieve a goal.
Then at the end, promise they don't have to do something they
hate doing, but in many cases, have to do to achieve that goal.

Examples of this framework in action:

* This Listening Secret Prevents Divorces For Frustrated Couples
(No Therapy Sessions)
* This Sleep Secret Reduces Wrinkles After 45 (No Botox)

*****************
Unemployed 4 Lyfe
*****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/6qheh8hl28ogq5io/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1YY1VBdm96Y3Y0aw==
)
Title: NEVER Say This in a Job Interview (or You’re DONE)

Framework: NEVER [Activity] This in a [High stakes situation] (or
You’re DONE)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/e0hph7h7n34gzrf8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +9783

Why this works:

Negativity - Warnings like this do a great job of grabbing the
audience's attention.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you wonder what "This"
is.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience to never do
something in a high-stakes situation, but build curiosity by not
specifying what it is they're not supposed to do.

Examples of this framework in action:

* NEVER Do This When Listing Your Home For Sale (or You’re DONE)
* NEVER Do This When Visiting Europe (or You’re DONE)

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hq8kw4qhmhrp2d2qqs3h2d992/58hvh7hg9d78eof6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1TSWJiNElRYXVFQQ==
)
Title: Stop Guessing! Use This Cabin Trick to Avoid Scratches

Hook score: -74

Why this flopped: The very first thing that came to my mind when
I read this was, “What am I guessing at?”

II didn’t have any context when I first read "Stop Guessing!" and
the exclamation mark told me that the first sentence was over, so
for a split second, I was confused. Definitely not the first
emotion you want someone to experience when they read your title.

Unfortunately, as I kept reading, I got even more confused. I
haven't really heard the term "Cabin" much in reference to cars.
I know what it means, but it's just not a term I hear that often,
so it took me a second to understand what I was reading.

I’m not necessarily a car guy, so maybe I’m not the right
audience, but ideally, your title is easily understood by
everybody.

So there are two things I’d fix here:

* I’d remove the “Stop Guessing!” part of the title and just get
straight to the meat of it.
* I’d swap out “cabin trick” for a word or term more people are
familiar with, like “hood trick” or “windshield trick.”

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

If you know a fellow creator who needs help with writing better
titles, share your referral link below with them.

- Jake

When you're writing titles, it often helps to talk about things
in broad terms. This makes it easier to read and understand.

In this example, most people don't know who Markelle Fultz is,
but even if they did, they may not be interested, or it may take
them a second to scan through their memory to remember who he is.

"NBA Bust" is way more interesting, easier to read, and easier to
understand.

If you find yourself getting into the weeds in your titles, back
it up a bit and give things broadly appealing labels so that your
audience can quickly and easily know what your video is about.

Title: Make This for Your Next Wine Night to Impress Everyone |
America's Test Kitchen

Hook score: -70

Why this flopped: I love that this title is about status —
impressing everyone. But why did it do so poorly compared to
other videos on the channel? Two reasons:

1) When you first glanced at the thumbnail, did you immediately
know what it was?

Maybe I'm just a simple man with simple tastes, but it took me a
second to realize what I was looking at.

It might've done better if it were a slightly clearer image of
clams (they are clams, right?).

Here's a quote to remember when making your titles and
thumbnails: "If you confuse, you lose."

2) I also love that this title is about a specific moment: making
food for wine night.

But how many people in this audience are making food for wine
night? It's possible it's not that popular of a moment, or the
audience isn't struggling to make food for that moment.

If they wanted to get away from the wine night angle, they could
try a title that just hypes up the clams, like, "These 10-Minute
Steamed Clams Will Change Your Life".

Title: Over 50? Ditch These 5 Summer Fashion Items in 2025!

Framework: (Specific audience)? Ditch These 5 (Season) (Entities)
in (Current year)!

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnh6gg7knf9hz5x4933cwh20nn2/vqh3hrhodq2mrrag/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +420

Why this works:

Specific Audience - Calling out a specific audience, like "Over
50?" in this case, is a great way to grab the right audience's
attention.

Negativity - This is about items NOT to wear, which leverages
people's fear of making a mistake and looking bad.

Timeliness - This uses timeliness to let the audience know this
is relevant right now in two ways:

* The current season
* The current year

How you can use this framework: Call out a specific audience and
tell them to ditch things that are relevant right now.

Examples of this framework in action:

* New Homeowner? Ditch These 5 Decorating Mistakes in 2025!
* Going to Europe this summer? Avoid These 5 Countries!

(Suffered from problem)

): +724

Why this works:

Negativity - This is all about a well-known problem, which grabs
attention.

Desire - This offers a little bit of hope. If Japan escaped this
problem, maybe there's a solution.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you wonder how Japan
escaped this problem (and what's wrong with Americans that made
them get fat).

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how one group
escaped a problem, while another group suffered from it.

Examples of this framework in action:

* How the UK escaped Mass Shootings while America grew Violent
* Why Amsterdam Rides Bikes while America is Stuck with Bad

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Curiosity - "Hidden" and "Keeping Quiet About On Purpose" both
make you feel like you're getting in on a secret.

Authority - The fact that "Airlines" are the ones keeping these
tricks quiet makes them feel more credible.

Desire - This creator's audience is into flight tricks. And I
feel like "On Purpose" makes these tricks seem even more
valuable.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about tricks
authority figures are keeping quiet about on purpose.

Credibility - Since he's gone to all 30, his opinion is more

Complete - Words like "all", "every", and "any" make videos feel

Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnh6gg7knf9hz5x4933cwh20nn2/9qhzhnhdlek4mpt9/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1McnR5QnpBZl92TQ==
)
Title: 11 Airport Secrets They DON'T Want Us to Know in 2025!

Hook score: -98

Why this flopped: This video was published in May of 2025, so "in
2025" just isn't that powerful anymore because it's closer to the
middle of the year.

If this were published in December, January, February, or March,
it might've done better.

Plus, the thumbnail is too vague.

The curiosity sweet spot is right in the middle of "I have no
idea what this is" and "I know exactly what this is."

The thumbnail points to something that's way too far on the "I
have no idea what this is" side, so it doesn't build enough
curiosity.

If you want to avoid a flop like this, use a better angle than
"in 2025" if it's in the middle of the year, and make the
imagery in your thumbnails more specific.

Title: How to Grade Your Dog's Behavior: From F to A

Hook score: -87

Why this flopped: People love benchmarks and seeing how they
compare, so why did this flop?

My guess is that people don't want to grade their dog's behavior,
they want to skip that step and just have a better-behaved dog.

The thumbnail hints at that, but the title doesn't.

It might've done better if it were, "How to Turn Your Dog's
Behavior From F to A".

Or, to be even more direct, we could try, "How to Turn Your Crazy
Dog Into a Calm, Obedient Dog".

The lesson: write your title about the end goal the audience will
get, not about the difficult journey they have to go on.

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator

).

*********

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/n4u4m0v4evtvhxolwo7b6h6pq0kggalhevqqe/z2hghnhe8o76gotp/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj03bmhHZDdwOHU2MA==
)
Title: Listening is *the only* skill you need to become fluent
(here's why)

Framework: [Activity] is *the only* skill you need to [Achieve
goal] (here's why)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/n4u4m0v4evtvhxolwo7b6h6pq0kggalhevqqe/6qheh8hldpwrqnuo/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +327

Why this works:

Curiosity - The constraint that listening is the only skill you
need to become fluent builds curiosity because it’s
counterintuitive. Shouldn’t speaking and other skills be
necessary, too?

Desire - This creator’s audience would love to become fluent.
Plus, the fact that listening is the only skill you need to
become fluent increases the audience's desire to learn about it.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the only
skill they need to achieve a goal.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Sleep is *the only* habit you need to master to get healthy
(here’s why)
* This is *the only* skill you need to blow up on Instagram

***************
Dollar Dwelling
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/n4u4m0v4evtvhxolwo7b6h6pq0kggalhevqqe/25h2hoh3e7g95la3/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1aTU1VZW1NaW9jcw==
)
Title: I Renovated This $1 House (Start to Finish)

Framework: I [Activity] This $1 [Entity] (Start to Finish)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/n4u4m0v4evtvhxolwo7b6h6pq0kggalhevqqe/6qheh8hldpwrqnuo/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +589

Why this works:

Desire - This leverages desire two ways:

* This creator's audience loves renovations.
* Since the house was only $1, some people feel like they could
do this, too.

Curiosity - $1 house builds so much curiosity because it makes
you ask all sorts of questions, like:

* How in the world did she get a $1 house?
* How bad of shape is a $1 house?
* What does it look like now?

A $1 house is kind of an oxymoron because it just doesn't seem
possible.

How you can use this framework: Do an activity your audience
wants to do and start with the absolute bare minimum.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I Turned $1K Into A $1,000,000 Business (Start to Finish)
* I Saved A Dying Marriage (Exactly How I Did It)

)
Title: This #1 Golf coach PROVES You’re HITTING driver all
wrong!!

Framework: This (Authority Figure) PROVES You’re (Activity) all
wrong!!

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/n4u4m0v4evtvhxolwo7b6h6pq0kggalhevqqe/6qheh8hldpwrqnuo/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +635

Why this works:

Authority - #1 Golf coach brings attention, trust and credibility
to this video.

Negativity - This is all about a pain point: hitting your driver
all wrong.

Credibility - This might be a little weak, but "PROVES" sounds
more credible and believable than just "explains why" or
something.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you want to know how this
coach proves you're hitting your driver all wrong.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about how an
authority figure proves they're doing something wrong.

Examples of this framework in action:

* This #1 Sales Trainer PROVES You're CLOSING deals all wrong!!
* This #1 Strength Coach PROVES You're BENCH PRESSING all wrong

***********

(

)
Title: Ex-CIA Officer Reveals 5 Signs Your Phone’s Been Hacked

Framework: (Authority Figure) Reveals 5 Signs (Problem has
happened)

​Hook score (

): +895

Why this works:

Authority - "Ex-CIA Officer" brings authority and trust to this
video.

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Negativity - This leverages the fear of your phone getting hacked
to grab your attention.

How you can use this framework: Have an authority figure reveal
signs that something bad has happened.

Examples of this framework in action:

Curiosity - "Secrets" is a great, simple way to build curiosity.

Negativity - "CHEATING" brings some controversy here that grabs

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/n4u4m0v4evtvhxolwo7b6h6pq0kggalhevqqe/z2hghnhe8o7x9oup/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1KY1hqLTF1Yk1Iaw==
)
Title: Is a Backup Gun Necessary for Self-Defense?

Hook score: -93

Why this flopped: Here's a strategy that I've heard a lot of
people recommend: Take questions your audience has asked and just
make videos answering them.

Sometimes that's a good strategy, but sometimes it leads to very
specific videos that don't resonate with a large part of your
audience.

That's what this video feels like to me.

But even with this very specific idea, I think the title could
still be better.

Titles that are bold opinions often do better on YouTube than
questions like this.

This video might have done better if the title were more
opinionated, like: "Here's Why You Don't Need A Backup Gun For
Self-Defense"

Or it could've taken more of a personal opinion and story angle:
"Here's Why I Never Carry A Backup Gun Anymore"

Or, if the topic of backup guns just isn't cutting it for the
audience, we could make it more broad.

Something like, "This Popular Self-Defense Hack Is A Waste Of
Time & Money".

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator

).

Easy Way Out
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/owhkhqhw73xkvqcv/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1GdmNBYXhzV21lSQ==
)
Title: Hate Talking On Camera for Content? THIS is for YOU

Framework: Hate (Beneficial, but difficult action)? THIS is for
YOU

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/z2hghnhe8954vmsp/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +359

Why this works:

Negativity - This starts with a pain point to grab the right
audience's attention.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you wonder what "THIS"
is.

How you can use this framework: Ask your audience if they hate
something that they have to or should do, then say your video is
for them.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Hate Cleaning Your Toilets? THIS is for YOU
* Hate "Productivity Hacks"? THIS is for YOU

**************
Helpful Habits
**************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/p8heh9h4lkr30esq/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj05RTJTZExEM0twYw==
)
Title: 30 Habits That (Quietly) Changed My Life Forever

Framework: 30 Habits That (Quietly) [Achieved Goal]

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/z2hghnhe8954vmsp/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1092

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Desire - This creator's audience would love to change their life.

Curiosity - "(Quietly)" kinda makes this feel like you're getting
in on a secret.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
habits that achieved a big goal in a quiet way.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 10 Habits That (Quietly) Changed My YouTube Channel Forever
* 5 Habits That (Quietly) Changed My Golf Game Forever

2 Bad
*****

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/dpheh0hemzd49zhm/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1qUFh6SVVicU5COA==
)
Title: Nintendo is ALREADY BANNING Switch 2

Framework: (Entity) is ALREADY (Negative Action) (Entity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/z2hghnhe8954vmsp/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1734

Why this works:

Negativity - People love drama like this.

Curiosity - The word "Already" makes this feel like the ban at
this time came as a surprise and makes you wonder why they're
banning it so soon.

News - People love news like this.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about some
news that is "already" happening. Bonus points if it's negative.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Tesla is ALREADY Crushing Waymo
* Celtics Are ALREADY Regretting Blowing Up Their Roster

***********
Video Proof
***********

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/e0hph7h729mp3pf8/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1SaU5PVkZvNUUtUQ==
)
Title: Do Snap Swivels REALLY Hurt Lure Action? (Side-by-Side
Look Underwater)

Framework: Do (Entities) REALLY Hurt (Desired outcome)? ([Proof
of evidence])

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/z2hghnhe8954vmsp/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +2138

Why this works:

Curiosity - This builds curiosity by asking a question, and the
"REALLY" enhances that curiosity.

Negativity - This is about avoiding a problem (hurting your lure
action).

Credibility - By promising a side-by-side underwater look, this
video feels more credible and believable.

How you can use this framework: Ask if something really causes a
problem, and then promise some element of proof.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Do Credit Checks REALLY Lower Your Credit Score? (FICO Score
Tracking)
* Does Leaving Your Phone Charging REALLY Damage the Battery? (30
Day Test)

***********
Oh, really?
***********

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/7qh7h8h9mvdk26bz/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1KMDZ0bHVON3J0RQ==
)
Title: Every Font is Free

Framework: Every (Entity) is Free

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/z2hghnhe8954vmsp/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +3755

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience would love for every front to be
free.

Curiosity - This is counterintuitive because many fonts are not
free.

This combo of desire + curiosity makes this video feel too good
to be true, but there's a sliver of hope, so you've gotta watch
it if you're a font guy or gal.

How you can use this framework: Make a bold, counterintuitive
statement that feels too good to be true.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Every Marketing Tool is Free
* Every Plane Ticket is Free

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hlnvm3li8h8dgz222blhpg00p/owhkhqhw73xkmnfv/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1JMEZZeXd0cFdMRQ==
)
Title: The 1 Bass Spawning Behavior I DIDN'T Expect (Dock Cam
Footage)

Hook score: -71

Why this flopped: This creator's audience has one goal: catch
more bass.

My guess is that although bass spawning behavior can be related
to catching bass, it's a few steps away.

It takes a bit of mental work for the audience to realize that
this video can help them with their main goal.

And since most people are mindlessly scrolling on YouTube, any
amount of mental work is often too much work, so they scroll on
by and choose another video.

A super simple change might be just: "The 1 Bass Behavior I
DIDN'T Expect (Dock Cam Footage)" (just remove the word
"spawning.")

You could also try a more dramatic title with a broader angle:
"Underwater Video Changes Everything I Thought I Knew About Bass"

TLDR: Know why people watch your videos and have your titles
reflect that, and make your titles super simple to read and
understand.

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

If you know a fellow creator who needs help with writing better
titles, share your referral link below with them.

))

).

Subject: The One Choice That Will Determine Your YouTube Channel's Success
Body:
​Read online (

)​

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator

).

************
Gossip Girls
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/25h2hoh30p4ronf3/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1pWF9zMWN2NnE0bw==
)
Title: “This Is What I Think Of Pete Hegseth” - Jocko Willink

Framework: “This Is What I Think Of (Trending or polarizing
subject)” - (Authority Figure)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/g3hnh5hmo867zrur/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +669

Why this works:

Authority - People are interested in what authority figures like
Jocko Willink have to say.

Timeliness - People love polarizing and/or trending topics, like
Pete Hegseth in this case.

Curiosity - This does a great job of opening a loop and making
you wonder what he thinks, so you have to click and find out.

How you can use this framework: This one is simple — just share
what an authority figure in your space thinks about a trending or
polarizing topic.

Examples of this framework in action:

* “This Is What I Think The Future of AI Is” - Sam Altman
* “This Is What I Think Of SGA” - Michael Jordan

************
Pre Practice
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/3ohphkh39546dgar/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1TaGE3dWR5cnJKbw==
)
Title: Don't start practicing art before you've done THIS

Framework: Don't start (Activity) before you've done THIS

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/g3hnh5hmo867zrur/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1618

Why this works:

Negativity - Warning someone to not do something does a great job
at grabbing their attention.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you want to know what
“THIS” is.

Urgency - This makes you feel like you need to watch this now.

How you can use this framework: Warn your audience to not do
something they want to do until they’ve done “this”.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Don't start meditating before you've done THIS
* Don't start stretching your hips before you've done THIS

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/x0hph6hedv987wb5/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
)
* Write better YouTube titles
* Grow your channel
* Save time

).

"Creator Hooks Pro gave me inspiration for the title of one of my
latest videos. It’s a 1 of 10 and already over 100K views in 4
days!”

- Ilana, Life Well Cruised 377K Subscribers

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/x0hph6hedv987wb5/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
)

​

****************
no pressure but…
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/n2hohvhv596wopf6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj14Vko5SU1vTjM5VQ==
)
Title: The One Choice That Will Determine Your Next 5 Years

Framework: The One (Action) That Will Determine (Future)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/g3hnh5hmo867zrur/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +4094

Why this works:

Curiosity - This builds curiosity two ways:

* It opens a loop and makes you wonder what the choice is.
* Since it's about just one choice, this constraint raises the
stakes of that one choice and makes it more interesting.

Time Frame - The time frame of "Your Next 5 Years" also raises
the stakes of this one choice.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about one
thing that will make a big difference for their future.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The One Choice That Will Determine Your Whole Career
* The One Choice That Will Determine America's Next 10 Years

**************
Perfect Powder
**************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/48hvhehmqd6z2dcx/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1kUFA1ZzRKYkVURQ==
)
Title: The SECRET Powder That Makes Plants Grow Faster & Repels
Pests!

Framework: The SECRET (Entity) That (Achieves goal) & (Removes
problem)!

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/g3hnh5hmo867zrur/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +4451

Why this works:

Curiosity - Using the word "Secret" is a simple way to build
curiosity and make the audience feel like they're getting in on a
secret.

Desire - This audience would love for their plants to grow
faster.

Negativity - They would also love to repel pests.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about a secret
thing that helps them achieve a goal and avoid a problem.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The SECRET Study Hack That Improves Retention & Stops
Procrastination!
* The SECRET Golf Drill That Adds Distance & Decreases Your
Slice!

******************
Healthy Addictions
******************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/wnh2hghqv2x9oet7/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1TMzl6b0huVi1vaw==
)
Title: Getting ADDICTED to STUDYING is Easy, Actually

Framework: Getting ADDICTED to (Beneficial, but hard activity) is
Easy, Actually

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/g3hnh5hmo867zrur/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +17518

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience wants to study more. The
confident tone of this title makes you feel like this video can
help you.

Curiosity - Many people struggle with studying, so saying it's
"Easy, Actually," is counterintuitive.

Controversy - Saying getting "ADDICTED" to studying is more bold,
polarizing, and controversial than just, "studying more," so it
grabs more attention.

Contrast - The contrast between "ADDICTED" (negative connotation)
and "STUDYING" (positive connotation) makes this title more
interesting.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that getting
addicted to something beneficial, but is sometimes hard to do, is
easy, actually.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Getting ADDICTED to Practicing Piano is Easy, Actually
* Getting ADDICTED to Eating Healthy is Easy, Actually

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/wvug8n9g59hghkoqlekt7hnvgwxxxh8h6l226/reh8hohmvlw956a2/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1OMjkxS0U2cnBjVQ==
)
Title: The Battle Between Elon, Trump & The Left - Naval Ravikant

Hook score: -82

Why this flopped: People love drama, so the idea of this sounds
great, but I think part of the reason it flopped because it's too
complicated.

Specifically, I think there are too many nouns.

Elon, Trump, The Left, Naval Ravikant — these four nouns make
this title hard to digest.

One thing they could do is take a stand and write the title about
just one of the sides: "Why Trump Is Dominating The Left - Naval
Ravikant"

(I'm not saying that's true or what this video is about — just
using this as an example.)

You could also argue that since this video has so few views
compared to the rest of the channel, people aren't interested in
this battle.

Part of this video is about power, and since this channel is
about improving yourself, that could be an interesting focus for
the title.

The title could be something like, "Why Leaders Today Have More
Power Than Any Other Man In History."

TLDR: Take a bold stance, or change the subject of the title if
your video is struggling.

Texas Terror
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp2qr57axh64z5777t5hwg44w/9qhzhnhd3nd6m0t9/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1DUXJRck9QbXN6RQ==
)
Title: We Chased Driverless Trucks In Texas. What We Saw Will
Scare You.

Framework: We (Investigated new technology). What We Saw Will
Scare You.

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp2qr57axh64z5777t5hwg44w/3ohphkh39v32lmhr/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +424

Why this works:

Credibility - This isn't just an armchair opinion — they actually
went and gathered firsthand information, which makes this video
feel more credible.

Negativity - Scary things do a great job of grabbing people's
attention and interest.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you wonder what they saw.

How you can use this framework: Go get firsthand information
about a new technology and build curiosity by only telling the
audience which emotion they'll feel about it.

Examples of this framework in action:

* We Tested AI Video Generators. What We Discovered Will Scare
You.
* We Tried Viral TikTok Beauty Products. What We Found Is
Horrifying.

Title: WTF Happened In 1971?

The thumbnail complements this perfectly by showing that
something big happened in 1971.

How you can use this framework: Ask what happened at a specific
point or time, and show a big change in a graph.

Examples of this framework in action:

* WTF Happened To New York City?

The Truth Hurts
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp2qr57axh64z5777t5hwg44w/48hvhehmqkmpeesx/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1ucEFadmtjSFlkUQ==
)
Title: You Don’t Want Love—You Want to Be Picked So You Feel
Worthy

Framework: You Don’t Want (Desirable entity)—You Want (True
desire)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp2qr57axh64z5777t5hwg44w/3ohphkh39v32lmhr/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1945

Why this works:

Curiosity - "You Don't Want Love" is counterintuitive to people
who assume they want love.

Negativity - Telling people what they don't want does a great job
of grabbing attention.

Desire - This resonates with the audience and reveals to them
what they truly desire.

Note: This format is only effective if you know your audience's
hopes, desires, and fears. The best creators know their audiences
better than their audience knows themselves.

How you can use this framework: Make a counterintuitive statement
telling the audience they don't want what they think they want,
and tell them what they actually want instead.

Examples of this framework in action:

* You Don't Want To Be Rich—You Want To Be Wealthy
* You Don't Want A Clean House—You Want to Feel In Control

**************
Burrito Ballin
**************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp2qr57axh64z5777t5hwg44w/wnh2hghqv8qkp2u7/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj0zZW5IdnM3VmFOOA==
)
Title: I Left The U.S. For India And Built A $23M Burrito
Business

Framework: I Left (Advantageous place) For (Seemingly less
advantageous place) And (Achieved big goal)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp2qr57axh64z5777t5hwg44w/3ohphkh39v32lmhr/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +2444

Why this works:

Curiosity - This builds curiosity three ways:

* It's counterintuitive because you think he'd have a better
chance at building a $23M business in the U.S. than in India.
* It's counterintuitive that a burrito business can be so big.
* And maybe I'm just an ignorant Florida man, but I don't
associate burritos with India, so that's also counterintuitive.

Desire - This creator's audience would love to build a $23M
business (bonus points if it involves burritos).

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how you, or
someone else, left an advantageous position for a less
advantageous position, but achieved something amazing.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I Ditched My $5,000 Canon For A Polaroid And Took Better Photos
* I Stopped Counting Calories And Lost 20 Pounds

*************
Melody Memory
*************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp2qr57axh64z5777t5hwg44w/reh8hohmvnm3rgb2/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1PLV83VlUxb25jbw==
)
Title: 50 Recognizable songs you don't know the name of

Framework: 50 Recognizable (Entities) (Counterintuitive
statement)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp2qr57axh64z5777t5hwg44w/3ohphkh39v32lmhr/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +3562

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Curiosity - The contrast between "recognizable songs" and "you
don't know the name of" builds curiosity.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about a list
of things they'd recognize, but don't truly know.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 20 Recognizable actors you don't know the name of
* 10 Psychological Hacks You See Every Day But Don't Realize It

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp2qr57axh64z5777t5hwg44w/08hwh9h2wq295lil/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1ZWWp5N21vRFRwdw==
)
Title: What It Really Takes To Transform Vehicles Into Homes

Hook score: -99

Why this flopped: One of the golden rules of marketing is to talk
about benefits, not features.

This title feels like it's doing the opposite — talking about
features, not benefits.

Talking about "what it really takes" isn't as exciting as what
you actually get: a sweet home made out of a vehicle.

If it were me, that's what I'd focus my title on. Something like,
"Turning A Van Into Your Home Will Change Your Life Forever".
This is focused more on what you get (change your life forever)
than what it takes.

Here's the lesson: think about the outcome your audience will get
from your video, and make the title about that.

Why this works:

Negativity - This is full of polarizing drama and controversy,
which does a great job at grabbing people's attention.

Even though this isn't a style I'd personally use, this does show
how drama and bold statements can do well on YouTube.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that something
is dead and they should have made a better decision.

Examples of this framework in action:

* THE DOLLAR IS DEAD! (YOU SHOULD HAVE BOUGHT BITCOIN!)​

* TIKTOK IS DEAD! (YOU NEED TO BE ON YOUTUBE!)
