Subject: I Tried 30 YouTube Strategies. These 5 Actually Worked…
Body:
​Read online (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/8ghqhohl4k2wn3hk/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2ktdHJpZWQtMzAteW91dHViZS1zdHJhdGVnaWVzLXRoZXNlLTUtYWN0dWFsbHktd29ya2VkLw==
) | Signup (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/vqh3hrhp58vmr3ig/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tLw==
)​

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

P.S. If you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator
Hooks Pro​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/l2hehmh3gwnq7zi6/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
).

*********
The Big 3
*********

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/m2h7h5h8rwq2zncm/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1hRTJJd3pycF85NA==
)
Title: I Tried 50 Business Ideas. These 3 Made Me Rich…

Framework: I Tried (Large Number of Options). These 3 (Achieved
Goal)...

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/e0hph7h0x5lmo0c8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +384

Why this works:

Credibility - This isn't just theory, he actually tried these
ideas and got real results with them. Also, trying 50 business
ideas tells us that he's put a lot of effort into this and is
someone worth listening to.

Desire - This creator's audience loves business ideas and would
love to get rich from their business.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you want to know what
these 3 business ideas are.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about how you
tried many of the options they're considering and which ones you
were successful with.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I Tried 50 Workout Supplements. These 5 Made Me Jacked…
* I Tried 50 Cookie Recipes. These 3 Were My Favorite…

*****************
Pickle Principles
*****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/7qh7h8hog36d59sz/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1YR0xRLTNzS0NvTQ==
)
Title: New Pickleball Rules for 2025 (MUST KNOW)

Framework: New [Entities] for [Upcoming Year] (MUST KNOW)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/e0hph7h0x5lmo0c8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +490

Why this works:

Timeliness - This video was published at the end of 2024 when
2025 was on everybody's mind.

Videos about changes for the new year like this are most powerful
between November of the previous year and February or so of the
current year.

New - Everybody loves new things.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about new
rules or other things for the upcoming year they must know.

Examples of this framework in action:

* New Tax Rules for 2025 (MUST KNOW)
* New Instagram Algorithm Changes for 2025 (MUST KNOW)

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/l2hehmh3gwnq7zi6/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
)
* Write better YouTube titles
* Grow your channel
* Save time

​Check out Creator Hooks Pro here (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/l2hehmh3gwnq7zi6/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
).

"Creator Hooks Pro gave me inspiration for the title of one of my
latest videos. It’s a 1 of 10 and already over 100K views in 4
days!”

- Ilana, Life Well Cruised 377K Subscribers

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/l2hehmh3gwnq7zi6/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
)

​

****************
Decadent Decades
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/x0hph6hwgxpk0kh5/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj0yaEM0YzVpZWFYUQ==
)
Title: How Did the Average American Live in Every Decade?

Framework: How Did the Average (Entity) (Activity) in Every (Time
Period)?

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/e0hph7h0x5lmo0c8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +572

Why this works:

Curiosity - This builds curiosity by asking a question.

"Every" - The word "every" gives this video a feeling of epicness
and completeness.

How you can use this framework: Analyze how an average person or
thing did an action in every time period.

Examples of this framework in action:

* What Was An Average NBA Game Like in Every Decade?
* What could you do on every version of the iPhone?

***************
9 Minute Method
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/58hvh7hmeln322h6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1Sc3NZTU4wbndPcw==
)
Title: Give Me 9 Minutes, and 2025 Will Be Your Best Year Yet

Framework: Give Me (Time Frame), and (You'll Achieve Goal)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/e0hph7h0x5lmo0c8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1322

Why this works:

Time Frame - The time frame of "9 minutes" makes this video feel
more tangible and interesting.

Timeliness - This was published at the end of 2024 when everybody
was excited about the upcoming year. It's a time when people are
planning for and getting excited about the future.

Desire - This creator's audience would love to have their best
year yet.

Curiosity - This title builds curiosity because it promises a big
benefit, but is vague about what you'll get from watching this
video and how you'll get it.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience to give you a
few minutes and they'll get a big benefit. Bonus points if that
benefit is relevant to what's going on right now.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Give Me 14 Minutes, and You'll Make Your First $1,000,000 In
2025
* Give Me 9 Minutes, and You'll Be Fluent In Spanish In 2025

*************
Rental Regret
*************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/9qhzhnhp7n64r5i9/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1hT09jWFdfRlBxMA==
)
Title: Bought 22 Rental Units and Now I Regret It. Here’s Why…

Framework: (Aspirational Action) and Now I Regret It. Here’s Why…

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/e0hph7h0x5lmo0c8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +19901

Why this works:

Credibility - This isn't just theory — she actually bought 22
rental units, which answers the question, "why should I listen to
you?"

Negativity - Regret is such a powerful negative emotion people
want to avoid, so this grabs attention.

Curiosity - "Here's Why..." adds some curiosity at the end and
makes you want to know why.

How you can use this framework: Do something your audience would
like to do, but explain why you regret it.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Finally Got a 6 Pack and Now I Regret It. Here’s Why…
* I Visited Every State in America and Now I Regret It. Here’s
Why…

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/o8u2zv92m9aqh6kekplavhqlemrrrso/wnh2hghwz8kmp9i7/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1YU3NCRld5UnZ2WQ==
)
Title: What Happened to the Merrill Lynch Mansion?

Hook score: -72

Why this flopped: If you want to build curiosity, there's a sweet
spot you gotta land in: your audience needs to have some idea of
what you're talking about to be interested, but not know too much
that they already know the answer.

In this case, I'd assume most people have no idea what happened
to the Merrill Lynch mansion or know anything about it, so their
curiosity isn't piqued enough.

This title might work if it was about something more familiar,
like the first White House, but obviously that's not the case.

So instead, I'd try to make this title about something more
familiar or easily understandable, like:

"The Most Insane Mansion In Southampton"

or

"Inside This $40,000,000 New York Mansion"

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

If you know a fellow creator who needs help with writing better
titles, share your referral link below with them.

- Jake

))

​Read online (

)​

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

P.S. If you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator
Hooks Pro​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32zxm2u2hdr0l666f7/8ghqhohl4pnez8ak/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
).

**************
Stealth Wealth

Creator Hooks

Long Lost Losses
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32wrqms2hd79mn66s7/owhkhqhre0gprwfv/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1FcjBhVTBqTGFGWQ==
)
Title: Archeologists Uncover How Napoleon Lost At Waterloo

Framework: (Authority Figures) Uncover (Explanation of dramatic
event)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32wrqms2hd79mn66s7/kkhmh6hlpo6rlrcl/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +303

Why this works:

Authority & Credibility - Since archeologists "uncovered"
something, it feels like this video has more authority and
credibility than just a random historian's opinion.

Negativity - This is about drama — a famous person's big loss —
which people love.

Curiosity - This also makes you wonder what they uncovered.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how authority
figures uncovered or discovered something dramatic.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Psychologists Discover Why People Struggle With Sleeping
* New Study Uncovers The Best Time To Invest In The Stock Market

********************
Better than Blender?
********************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32wrqms2hd79mn66s7/25h2hoh2xq462wh3/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1GSmd5NVFlUlNHMA==
)
Title: Why do Studios Ignore Blender?

Framework: Why do (Authority figures) Ignore (Popular solution)?

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32wrqms2hd79mn66s7/kkhmh6hlpo6rlrcl/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +630

Why this works:

Authority - "Studios" are big authority figures in the VFX world.

Negativity - This is about drama and controversy — studios
ignoring a popular software.

Curiosity - This builds curiosity by asking a question.

How you can use this framework: Ask why the leaders in your niche
are ignoring a solution lots of people like and use.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Why do Hedge Funds Ignore Crypto?
* Why do Doctors Ignore Holistic Medicine?

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32wrqms2hd79mn66s7/n2hohvh34l6m3ls6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1pZHJid25XTEo3dw==
)
Title: What staying up all night does to your brain - Anna
Rothschild

Framework: What (Common, innocent mistake) does to your
(Possession)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32wrqms2hd79mn66s7/kkhmh6hlpo6rlrcl/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +811

Why this works:

Negativity - This hints that something many people do might be
causing a problem.

Tangible - "What staying up all night does to your brain" feels
more tangible and specific than just, "What staying up all night
does to you." This builds more curiosity and makes this title
more interesting.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience what a common
or innocent mistake they're making does to something specific of
theirs.

Examples of this framework in action:

* What scrolling social media does to your attention span
* What job hopping says to hiring managers

************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32wrqms2hd79mn66s7/48hvhehr376vr3ax/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1RN0M4OWFyMURIQQ==
)
Title: If You FEEL Time Slips Away, Watch This!

Framework: If You (Experience Problem), Watch This!

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32wrqms2hd79mn66s7/kkhmh6hlpo6rlrcl/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +9851

Why this works:

Negativity - This is about a problem many people have.

Curiosity - This implies that this video is a solution for people
who feel time slips away, but doesn't say anything about the
actual solution, so you've gotta click to see what it is.

Being vague like this can backfire, but the thumbnail text
mentions a benefit and the problem presented in the tile (feeling
time slip away) is such a common and tangible problem that this
title gets away with it.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience if they're
experiencing a certain problem, watch your video.

Examples of this framework in action:

* If You FEEL Like Your Biceps Aren't Growing, Watch This!
* If You Think Travel is TOO EXPENSIVE, Watch This

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh32wrqms2hd79mn66s7/vqh3hrhp6qelo4ig/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj0xdkx6b3VBcFhWRQ==
)
Title: Why Tutankhamun's Tomb Is The Biggest Discovery Of All
Time

Hook score: -91

Why this flopped: I like this title — "biggest discovery of all
time" is an exciting promise.

But apparently the audience didn't like it.

Now it could've been because everyone knows him as "King Tut" and
not "Tutankhamun." If it were me, I would've gone with his
nickname instead of his full name.

But since they used "King Tut" in the thumbnail, I don't think
that's the main reason this video flopped.

It was probably because the topic or angle didn't resonate. And
since we're stuck with the topic, let's try some different
angles.

We could try to zoom in on a specific detail:

"This Tiny Box In King Tut's Tomb Is The Biggest Discovery Of All
Time"

We could zoom out and make it more easily understandable and
broadly appealing:

"This Ancient Egyptian Tomb Is The Biggest Discovery Of All Time"

Or we could try to add more curiosity:

"This Ancient Egyptian Tomb Changes Everything We Know About
History"

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

).

***

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp5n20kuxh620lm77i5/m2h7h5h8xvnk38sm/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1wWHRCRmlGXzMyaw==
)
Title: the death of personal style

Framework: the death of (Polarizing, changing, or declining
topic)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp5n20kuxh620lm77i5/dpheh0h0xv7zeehm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +312

Why this works:

Negativity - "the death of" brings conflict and controversy,
which people love.

Confirms Suspicions - Because of celebrities, influencers, and
social media, trends are more prevalent and fast-moving. Many
people already kinda feel like personal style is dying (or at
least changing), so this video latches onto that feeling.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
death of something that's changing or struggling.

Examples of this framework in action:

* the death of office jobs
* the death of AAA games

*****************
Peace out Plastic
*****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp5n20kuxh620lm77i5/e0hph7h0z6n97qu8/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1YMkMwMzJqMjJQSQ==
)
Title: Could this new material replace plastic?

Framework: Could this new (Entity) replace (Existing, problematic
entity)?

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp5n20kuxh620lm77i5/dpheh0h0xv7zeehm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +516

Why this works:

New - People love new things.

Curiosity - This builds curiosity by asking a question.

How you can use this framework: Ask if a new material can replace
an existing entity that should or needs to be replaced.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Could this new platform replace TikTok?
* Could this new currency replace crypto?

(

Title: I Tried a 1-Star Cruise

Framework: I Tried a (Poorly-rated entity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp5n20kuxh620lm77i5/dpheh0h0xv7zeehm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +588

Why this works:

Negativity & Curiosity - The tension of trying a 1-star thing is
so intriguing because people want to see what happened and how
bad it turned out.

How you can use this framework: Try a poorly-rated thing in your
niche.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I Hired a 1-Star Stylist
* I Tried a 1-Star Restaurant

*************

(

)
Title: You’re Not Behind: Why Everyone SEEMS To Have More Money
Than You

Framework: You’re Not (Undesirable State): Why Everyone SEEMS To
(Be in a better position) Than You

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp5n20kuxh620lm77i5/dpheh0h0xv7zeehm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +738

Why this works:

Negativity - This is all about a pain point: feeling like
everyone has more money than you.

Status - This is also about your status and how wealthy you are
compared to everyone else.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that they're
not in an unwanted state and why everyone SEEMS to be in a better
situation than them.

Examples of this framework in action:

* You’re Not Messy: Why Everyone SEEMS To Be More Organized Than
You
* You’re Not Awkward: Why Everyone SEEMS To Be More Charismatic
Than You

************
Lazies Unite
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp5n20kuxh620lm77i5/p8heh9hzem7k4miq/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj00THNqN3ktRnh2UQ==
)
Title: If You’re Creative But Lazy Please Watch This

Framework: If You’re (Positive Attribute) But (Undesirable
Attribute) Please Watch This

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp5n20kuxh620lm77i5/dpheh0h0xv7zeehm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +2072

Why this works:

Specific Audience - If you identify as creative, but lazy (which
is a lot of us), this title makes you feel like this video was
made specifically for you, so you're more likely to watch it.

Negativity - Most people don't want to be lazy, so this calls out
a pain point and grabs your attention.

Curiosity - This title is a cliffhanger. You know who it's for
and what problem it addresses, but nothing else, which piques
your curiosity.

How you can use this framework: Call out a very specific audience
with a specific problem and tell them to watch your video.

Examples of this framework in action:

* If You’re Ambitious But Lazy Please Watch This
* If You Want to Eat Healthy But Crave Junk Food, Please Watch
This

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/4zukqpmkgmtehp5n20kuxh620lm77i5/x0hph6hwmo78e2s5/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj0wdjMzckZ0SHVTMA==
)
Title: WARNING: AI Is Stealing People's Homes

Hook score: -83

Why this flopped: I really like the way this title is written, so
why did it flop?

My guess is that it's not very believable.

I'm writing this on my couch and having a really hard time
imagining AI busting down my door and stealing my home from me.

My house is just too tangible and I don't think it's going
anywhere (although Hurricane Milton tried last year).

I'm not saying the content in the video isn't true, I'm saying
just by reading the title I have a hard time imagining it to be.

Now if this was about AI stealing my identity, bank account, or
even people's teslas out of their driveways, that'd be more
believable because you can easily envision that happening.

So the next time you're deciding whether or not to make a video
ask yourself: is this topic believable? Can people imagine how it
would happen?

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

titles, share your referral link below with them.

)​

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

P.S. If you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator
Hooks Pro​ (

).

************
Healthy Baby
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/x0hph6hwmnkmvvs5/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1uZS1Ud1U3VVdBaw==
)
Title: 15 Signs Your Pregnancy Is Going Well in The First
Trimester

Framework: 15 Signs Your (Journey or Entity) Is Going Well (In
the beginning)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/6qheh8h74px48mio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +913

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Desire - Pregnant women would love to see signs their pregnancy
is going well.

New - This one might be a bit of a stretch, but in the first
trimester pregnancy is new, exciting, and nerve-wracking, so it's
calling out a specific audience. Plus, later in pregnancy,
there's often a clear sign the baby is doing well that you don't
have in the first trimester: the baby kicking.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
signs a new thing is going well.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 15 Signs Your New YouTube Channel Is Going Well
* 10 Signs A Relationship Looks Promising After The First Date

******************
The Future Is Here
******************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/kkhmh6hlp8zp0xil/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1aM3V2V0FyTW5iWQ==
)
Title: The future of social media | 2025 trends you NEED to know

Framework: The future of (Niche) | (Upcoming or current year)
trends you NEED to know

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/6qheh8h74px48mio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1080

Why this works:

Curiosity & Desire - Everybody wants to know what the future
holds, but nobody actually knows, so the future is such a great
topic because it's full of curiosity and desire.

Timeliness - This video was published at the end of 2024 when
2025 was on everybody's mind.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
future of your industry and current trends they need to know.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The future of interior design | 2025 trends you NEED to know
* The future of gardening | 2025 trends you NEED to know

***********************************
Stop Writing The Same Boring Titles
***********************************

* Get 30 title ideas in 30 seconds
* Beat blank page syndrome
* Grow your channel

​Get Creator Hooks Pro here (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/z2hghnh3zo5z2xap/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
).

P.S. Here's what one Creator Hooks Pro customer said about
Creator Hooks Pro:

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/z2hghnh3zo5z2xap/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
)​

​

***************
Pastor Problems
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/58hvh7hmw53wd4f6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj00NXl2c1dPcS0zTQ==
)
Title: If You Hear a Pastor SKIP This Verse... RUN!! (Here's What
They Are Hiding)

Framework: If You Hear a (Authority Figure) (Avoid Entity)...
RUN!! (Here's What They Are Hiding)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/6qheh8h74px48mio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +2403

Why this works:

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you want to know what
"this verse" is.

Negativity - This has lots of drama and conspiracy, which people
love.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that if an
authority figure they trust is skipping something, they should
run.

Examples of this framework in action:

* If Your Financial Advisor SKIPS This Step... RUN!! (Here's What
They Are Hiding)
* If Your Lawyer IGNORES This Law... RUN! (Here's What They Are
Hiding)

*************
Daily Drawing
*************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/25h2hoh2x7lxpxa3/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj13RFZmMWtRWC1PNA==
)
Title: One Trick to Draw Everyday with Ease

Framework: One Trick to (Desirable, but sometimes difficult
activity) Everyday with Ease

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/6qheh8h74px48mio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +3150

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience would love to easily draw every
day.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you want to know what the
"one trick" is.

Daily - There's something about doing an activity every day
that's exciting. It's tangible and aspirational, so talking about
doing things every day can be great to use in titles.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about one
trick to do something they want to do, but is sometimes difficult
to stick with, every day with ease.

Examples of this framework in action:

* One Trick to Eat Healthy Everyday with Ease
* One Trick to Meditate Everyday with Ease

************
Less is More
************

(

)
Title: Why Studying Less will Give You an UNFAIR ADVANTAGE

Framework: Why (Counterintuitive Statement)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/6qheh8h74px48mio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +3443

Why this works:

Curiosity - This is counterintuitive. How can studying less give
you an advantage?

Desire - This leverages desire in two ways:

* Everybody would love to study less.
* Everybody wants an unfair advantage.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how doing
something counterintuitive and desirable will give them an unfair
advantage.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Why Eating MORE Can Help You Lose Weight
* Why Running Slower Will Make You FASTER

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hp8g620u5h29ozdlltn/9qhzhnhp8g48oqs9/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1PUWhVYjl1ZnBETQ==
)
Title: A Mother Forgives and "ADOPTS" Her Son's MURDERER... (True
Story)

Hook score: -95

Why this flopped: Here are some of the most-viewed titles on this
channel:

* If You Hear a Pastor SKIP This Verse... RUN!! (Here's What They
Are Hiding)
* They "REMOVED" This Verse From The Bible!! (WHY??)
* Pastors Want This Video BANNED!! (You'll See Why)​

Two things are clear from these titles:

* The videos are about Christianity
* The videos are educational

This title doesn't meet either of those criteria.

It's a story and doesn't say anything about Christianity, which
is probably a big part of why it didn't get as many views as most
of the other videos on this channel.

Two things he could do:

First, make it clear that this video is about a Christian to
attract the right audience:

"Christian Woman Forgives and "ADOPTS" Her Son's MURDERER...
(True Story)"

(Note that we're using a keyword not to let the algorithm know
what this video is about, but to let the audience know.)

The other option is to spin it in an educational way:

"The Bible Verse That Let This Woman Forgive and "ADOPT" Her
Son's MURDERER"

To avoid a flop like this on your channel, know why people watch
your channel and deliver on that premise in each video.

Creator Hooks

)
Title: Psychoanalyst's Advice For Young Parents | Erica Komisar

Framework: (Authority Figure’s) Advice For (Noobs)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hl78z56urh8nq6e99bm/wnh2hghwd9lomxb7/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +301

Why this works:

Authority - "Psychoanalyst" brings authority and credibility to
this title.

Beginners - Calling out beginners, or, in this case, "Young
Parents," is great for grabbing attention because they're the
most eager to learn.

Desire - Young or new parents often appreciate the advice of an
authority figure.

How you can use this framework: Share the advice of an authority
figure for beginners or new people in your niche.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Physical Therapist's Advice For New Runners
* Realtor's Advice For New Home Buyers In Miami

**************
Aloe Accidents
**************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hl78z56urh8nq6e99bm/reh8hoh0p9o5kxb2/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj0zN2ZRaG9rZHpkcw==
)
Title: I Stopped Killing Aloe Vera Once I Knew This

Framework: I Stopped (Unwanted Accident) Once I Knew This

): +645

Why this works:

Negativity - This is all about stopping an accidental problem.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you want to know what
"this" is.

Desire - This creator's audience would love to stop killing their
aloe vera.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how to stop
accidentally doing something once they learn "this".

): +795

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Status - This is about status: are you a winner or loser?

Timeliness - This video was published at the end of 2024 when
2025 was on everybody's mind.

Desire - This creator's audience loves AI and wants to get better
at using it.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
skills that will separate the winners from the losers this year.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The 8 Soft Skills That Will Separate Winners From Losers in
2025
* The 5 YouTube Skills That Will Separate Winners From Losers in
2025

********

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hl78z56urh8nq6e99bm/vqh3hrhp62qkmlbg/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1yRXAxVHByYkhNYw==
)
Title: Psychopathic Stalker Goes Before the Wrong Judge

Framework: (Polarizing Entity) (Action) the Wrong (Entity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hl78z56urh8nq6e99bm/wnh2hghwd9lomxb7/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1478

Why this works:

Curiosity - This title does a great job of starting a story to
grab your attention. It's a cliffhanger that uses tension and
almost forces you to click because you've got to see what
happens.

Negativity - "Psychopathic Stalker" and "Wrong Judge" bring some
drama and conflict to get you interested in this video.

How you can use this framework: Use a cliffhanger to build
tension around a story involving dramatic characters.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Naive YouTuber Travels to the Wrong Country
* Cocky Bully Picks on the Wrong Kid

**********************
Life Changing Notebook
**********************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hl78z56urh8nq6e99bm/l2hehmh3p5dkq2f6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1QcU1KV3pFQjdiYw==
)
Title: A notebook to replace doomscrolling

Framework: A (Object) to replace (Problem)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hl78z56urh8nq6e99bm/wnh2hghwd9lomxb7/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +8320

Why this works:

Negativity - "doomscrolling" is a problem that many people in
this audience resonate with.

Desire - This creator's audience would love to stop doomscrolling
by using something more wholesome, like this notebook.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about a simple
product that fixes or replaces a problem.

Examples of this framework in action:

* A keyboard to stop distractions
* A drink to replace stress eating

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hl78z56urh8nq6e99bm/7qh7h8hoevx4druz/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj1ZN3FVb0hyZzZIdw==
)
Title: Judge DiSanto Calls This Court Case Her “Daily Disaster”

Hook score: -92

Why this flopped: People make this mistake all the time: using
proper names at the wrong time.

Unless the person's name is a household name, like Elon Musk or
LeBron James, it's often better to use their position, like
judge, NBA player, etc.

This is because if people don't immediately recognize the name,
that may cause them to not be interested in the video. On the
other hand, everybody will immediately recognize "judge."

On top of that, it seems like the audience isn't really into this
angle.

Here are a few other angles:

"This Court Case Ruined This Judge's Life"

This adds a bit more drama and may be too hyperbolic, but people
do love drama.

"Drunk Defendant Accidentally Makes His Case A Lot Worse"

Again adding more drama here, but it's also a bit more
interesting because it gives more detail about the defendant, as
opposed to the vague, "daily disaster".

If your initial angle isn't working, switch it up and try
something new, don't just make tiny little changes.

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

(

)
Title: STOP talking about "going to heaven"

Framework: STOP talking about "(Common Goal or Desire)"

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/k0uo4dkoxki6h5gzw0zhlhomel577f8/25h2hoh2qpqol8f3/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +350

Why this works:

Negativity - Telling someone to stop doing something they think
is good or is common is a great way to grab their attention.

Curiosity - This is counterintuitive because many people in this
creator's audience think the goal of Christianity is to go to
Heaven. The thumbnail text also challenges that assumption.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience to stop
talking about something they think is good or is common.

Examples of this framework in action:

* STOP talking about "going viral"
* STOP talking about "being productive"

*************
The Afterlife

* Dreams Showdown: Following Your Heart vs Playing It Safe
* Take your dreams seriously before it's too late.

These are all about a similar angle: taking your dreams
seriously.

If your video isn't doing as well as you hoped, it's often best
to totally switch up the angle.

Here are some options:

"Quit Putting Your Dreams On Pause"

Similar message, but it's a warning that brings a bit more drama.

"Stop Letting Life Pass You By"

different way to tap into the audience's biggest fears and
frustrations.

"Read This Book To Make 2025 Your Best Year Ever"

New angle that talks about the benefits of this book and brings
some timeliness into it.

Lesson: if a video didn't do well, come up with titles from new
angles that bring more curiosity, fear, or desire.

Body:

)​

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

P.S. If you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles from this newsletter, check out ​Creator
Hooks Pro​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/e0hph7h0dm4dkza8/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9nZXQtY3JlYXRvci1ob29rcy1wcm8=
).

*******************
The Secret Sauce(s)
*******************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/owhkhqhr0xo0r3fv/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj14bmlTN2tNcFc0SQ==
)
Title: The 5 Sauces Every Chef Needs to Learn

Framework: The (Number) (Entities) Every (Person Who Does
Activity) Needs to (Activity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/p8heh9hzprxpz2cq/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +346

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Desire - This creator's audience wants to learn about delicious
sauces.

Curiosity - The way this is written opens a loop and makes you
wonder what these sauces are.

"Every" - The word "every" makes this list feel more epic,
interesting, and relevant for, well, every chef.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
things everyone in your niche needs to do.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The 5 Countries Every Traveler Needs to Visit
* The 5 Books Every Entrepreneur Needs to Read

***************
Legendary Licks
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/58hvh7hm4374m9c6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj01YmZoZFNnLTBNSQ==
)
Title: Why Did LEGENDARY Guitarists Do This?

Framework: Why Did LEGENDARY (Professionals) Do This?

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/p8heh9hzprxpz2cq/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +714

Why this works:

Authority - This video has credibility because it's about what
the legendary guitarists did.

Curiosity - This builds curiosity by asking a question.

How you can use this framework: Ask why the legends in your niche
did something, and in the thumbnail show something weird or
unexpected.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Why Did LEGENDARY Painters Do This?
* Why Did LEGENDARY Army Generals Do This?

(

*************

(

)
Title: 7 Cybersecurity Tips NOBODY Tells You (but are EASY to do)

Framework: 7 [Niche or Activity] Tips NOBODY Tells You (but are
EASY to do)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/p8heh9hzprxpz2cq/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1006

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Curiosity - "NOBODY Tells You" makes you feel like you're getting
in on a secret.

Desire - This creator's audience wants cybersecurity tips and the
"(but are EASY to do)" bit at the end makes these tips even more
desirable.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the tips
nobody tells them about, but are easy to do.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 7 Gardening Tips NOBODY Tells You (but are EASY to do)
* 7 Sewing Tips NOBODY Tells You (but are EASY to do)

******************
Anything But These
******************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/reh8hoh0okxo0dh2/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj15Rjk2WmwyeUwzMA==
)
Title: The Dog Breeds I HATE To Work With As A Dog Trainer!

Framework: The (Entities) I HATE To (Activity) As A
(Professional)!

): +1432

Why this works:

Authority - The fact that he's a dog trainer makes his opinion
and this video more credible.

Curiosity - This makes you wonder what dog breeds he's talking
about (and what dog breeds you shouldn't get — or if your dog is
on this list).

Negativity - People love juicy drama and negativity like this.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
things you hate as a professional.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The Car Brands I HATE To Work On As A Mechanic!
* Exercises I NEVER Recommend As A Physical Therapist

********************
Sweet Sweet Sweaters
********************

(

Framework: 5 MUST-TRY (Activities) for Beginners!

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/p8heh9hzprxpz2cq/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +1560

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Desire - This creator's audience is into crochet sweater
patterns.

Beginners - Calling out beginners in your titles is so powerful
because they're the biggest, most eager-to-learn part of any
audience.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
must-try things for beginners.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 5 MUST-TRY Piano Songs for Beginners!
* 5 MUST-SEE Animes If You're Just Getting Into It

********************
A/B Test of the Week
********************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/7qh7h8hoxdzxogbz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tLzEwMy15b3V0dWJlLXRpdGxlLWEtYi10ZXN0cw==
)
Many people overcomplicate their titles and thumbnails.

Here's an example where simplifying your title to make it more
punchy and emotional and focusing on attracting a single group
(only freelancers — not freelancers and SMBs), improved the CTR.

If you want to see 100+ other test results like this, you can
​​get the 103 YouTube AB tests ebook here​​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/r8umw07mv7foh39w3mkt2hd783m66s7/7qh7h8hoxdzxogbz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tLzEwMy15b3V0dWJlLXRpdGxlLWEtYi10ZXN0cw==
).

Title: 20 Veggies You Can Plant In December RIGHT NOW!

Framework: 20 (Entities) You Can (Activity) In (Current Time)
RIGHT NOW!

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/0vu48kv4qvt9h90kozgtlhv6rpk55hn/25h2hoh2qol65pc3/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLw==
): +335

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Desire - This creator's audience wants to plant veggies now. But
they might be thinking winter is not a good time to plant
veggies, so this topic is even more exciting.

Timeliness - This video was published at the end of November and
is all about what to do right now.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about things
they can do this month right now.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 10 Stocks I'm Investing In For December RIGHT NOW!

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you wonder what "This"
is.

Negativity - Calling out ADHD and saying it's a curse grabs
people's attention.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that something
they struggle with is a bad or a curse until they learn "this".

what the video will be about) and they add curiosity.

Negativity - This leverages fear to grab your attention and get

)
Title: 6 things your (introvert) woman needs you to understand
about dating her

Hook score: -82

Why this flopped: The most successful videos on this channel are
about benefits or fears for the audience:

* "These types of women ALWAYS cheat on their men" 329K views
* "How to turn any woman on (without touching her)" 294K views
* "Giving her distance is your superpower" 120K views

"6 things your (introvert) woman needs you to understand about
dating her" is kind of about the audience, but more about their
woman. And although the audience cares about their woman, they
care about themselves more.

Not to mention, the fact that this is about dating introverted
women narrows the audience a bit (which isn't necessarily bad),
but the audience needs to think for a second — is my woman an
introvert?

If I were to rewrite this title, I'd try to make it more about
the audience:

"If You're Dating An Introvert You Need To Know THIS"

or

"6 Things You NEED To Know If You're Dating An Introvert"

curiosity-filled topic.

happen.

consume that content.

Timeliness - This is about a current event, which almost adds
some urgency to this title.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that something
is about to happen in their niche.

little more specific about the benefits of this video:

Subject: How to brainstorm video ideas in Creator Hooks Pro
Preview:
Hey Ian,

This email is for my YouTube nerds who like to get into the weeds
and really get their wheels spinning about YouTube titles, ideas,
and thumbnails.

Creator Hooks Pro has a database of
Body:
Hey Ian,

This email is for my YouTube nerds who like to get into the weeds
and really get their wheels spinning about YouTube titles, ideas,
and thumbnails.

Creator Hooks Pro has a database of over 1,000 hand-picked viral
videos.

One of my favorite ways to get my brain in the mode of coming up
with good titles and ideas is to scroll through the database, see
what’s worked for other channels, and see how I can use those
strategies for my own channel.

But to find titles that are specifically related to what you’re
looking for, we’ve got filters for you.

Here’s what they are and how to use them:

​
Click Triggers

This filter is for when you have an idea for an emotion or angle
in a title, but you want to see how others have successfully used
it in their titles.

For example, if you want to see how others have used curiosity,
you would filter by the curiosity click trigger and then get 100s
of examples of how to build curiosity.

Channel Type

If you want to narrow things down a bit and only see videos from
channels that create the same type of content as you, such as
talking head, faceless, or vlog channels, this filter is for you.

The channel type and video type are my two favorite filters if
I’m just looking to browse and don’t really know what my idea or
title is.

Niche

Most people’s first reaction is to use the niche filter, but I
recommend against that. The cool thing about the database is that
it lets you easily see successful videos from a variety of
niches, and lets you bring things that are working in other
niches over to yours.

That being said, filtering by your niche can help you find good
topics and see what's working for similar channels.

Video Type

If you know what type of video you’re making, such as a review,
list, or interview, this filter is perfect. It shows you exactly
how successful creators on YouTube have packaged this type of
video, so the results are highly relevant.

Search

The best way to use the search function is to search for broad
words, like “mistake,” “secret,” or “top 10” to see how others
have used the angle you're considering. Searching for
niche-specific words is hit or miss with the database.

If you want specific words related to your niche, I’d use the
generator to generate titles using those words.

And here’s one last tip to get the most out of the generator:

If you spend a lot of time browsing it and using the same filters
over and over, you’ll eventually start to see the same titles. To
prevent this, go to the sort by dropdown on the top right and
select “Random.” This will help you discover new titles and keep
the ideas flowing.

You can view the database here:
https://pro.creatorhooks.com/home?tab=database (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi0ux20n7h8h89ex022cl/8ghqhohlmqqqp3sk/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9ob21lP3RhYj1kYXRhYmFzZQ==
)​

Happy brainstorming!

- Jake

P.S. If Creator Hooks Pro helps you get a 1 of 10 video I’d love
to hear about it! You can email me at jake@creatorhooks.com or
tag me on LinkedIn (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi0ux20n7h8h89ex022cl/vqh3hrhpzeee33ug/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubGlua2VkaW4uY29tL2luL2pha2UtdGhvbWFzLWNyZWF0b3ItaG9va3Mv
) or Twitter (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi0ux20n7h8h89ex022cl/l2hehmh38666vzi6/aHR0cHM6Ly90d2l0dGVyLmNvbS9qdGhvbWFzX18=
), like this:

​

Subject: the secret to getting more views with Creator Hooks Pro
Preview:
Hey Ian,

Here's how people get the most views with Creator Hooks Pro:

They don’t just generate one set of titles, copy one, and then go
on their merry way.

They:

* Generate a handful of t
Body:
Hey Ian,

Here's how people get the most views with Creator Hooks Pro:

They don’t just generate one set of titles, copy one, and then go
on their merry way.

They:

* Generate a handful of titles
* See which ones they like best
* Mix and match different words and phrases
* Come up with the perfect title for their video

Here are 3 easy steps so you can do that, too:

Step 1: Generate titles

Write 3-10 words describing your video in the description box and
generate titles.

​
Step 2: Save your favorites

When you see a title you like, even if you only like a phrase or
a word in it, click the bookmark icon to the left of the title.

This will open up your folders in the right sidebar. Create a
folder for the video you're working on so you can save all your
potential titles in one place.

​
Step 3: Repeat

Generate a few more sets of titles and save 10 or more of your
favorites.

Then look through your list, see which titles or phrases you like
best, and decide on the perfect title for your video.

Bonus Tip: Use the unused titles

All of those titles you didn’t use are perfect for:

* Thumbnail text angles
* Intro inspiration
* Subtopics within your video
* Ideas for your next video

And since you’ve saved them all to a folder, you can easily come
back whenever you want and get your wheels spinning again.

Click the “Favorites” tab on the left sidebar or the bookmark
icon at the top right to view your folders.

You can start generating titles here:
https://pro.creatorhooks.com/home?tab=titles (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/n4u4m0v4evtqudk350u6h630lkggil/8ghqhohlmqx6n3sk/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9ob21lP3RhYj10aXRsZXM=
)​

Happy titling!

- Jake

P.S. The FAQ tab on the left sidebar has more tips for you about
using Creator Hooks Pro!

Body:
Hey Ian,

Thanks for signing up for Creator Hooks Pro!

Here's the link for you to log in (I recommend bookmarking it for
easy access):

​https://pro.creatorhooks.com/ (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/k0uo4dkoxki2uwdll5blhomel577f8/owhkhqhr7d5z0qiv/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS8=
)​

The title generator is our most popular feature, but the biggest
question people have about it is, "What do I put in the
description box about my video?”

Here's a simple answer: describe what your video is about in 2-10
words.

This isn't ChatGPT where giving more information will help it
write a better title.

Great YouTube titles have a singular focus, so if you want the
title generator to write good titles for you, it works best if
you tell it what to focus on.

But if at first it doesn’t give you titles you like, you can
generate different titles by:

* Shortening up your description and being more broad (e.g.
"YouTube tips").
* Making it a little longer and being more specific (e.g.
"YouTube tips for busy business owners who don't like being on
camera").

You can access the title generator here:
https://pro.creatorhooks.com/home?tab=titles (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/k0uo4dkoxki2uwdll5blhomel577f8/x0hph6hwo0z0vqb5/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9ob21lP3RhYj10aXRsZXM=
)​

Enjoy!

- Jake

P.S. Below the generator results on the right, you'll see little
thumbs up/thumbs down buttons. You can click those to let me know
what you liked or didn't like about the results. It's massively
helpful for me when you give feedback so I know how to make the
title generator better for you.

Body:
The best way to come up with video ideas is to remake your proven
topics from dozens of different angles.

When I managed a fishing channel at my last job, "trout lures"
was one of our most successful topics.

Every week we would make a video about trout lures:

* 10 Mistakes You're Making With Trout Lures
* The ONLY Trout Lure You Need This Fall
* The #1 Rule For Throwing Trout Lures
* I Wish I Tried This Lure Sooner…

We had 5-10 topics we cycled through and it worked really well
for us (we went from about 70K subscribers when I started to
200K+ subscribers by the time I left).

But this process was slow, manual work.

That’s why I built this automatically into Creator Hooks Pro.

The generator stores your proven topics so with just one click

Body:
Howdy!

When I go to write titles, I struggle with two things:

* It's hard to get started and beat "blank page" syndrome.
* Once I do get started, I use my same go-to formats every time.

It’s tough to get out of my normal way of thinking and actually
think outside the box about new, better, spicier ways to write my
titles.

Do you struggle with that, too?

The best way to beat this is to read through a list of proven
titles. It’s kinda like a warm-up for your brain.

I used to do it by reading through a Google sheet with all of my
favorite titles.

You could also create a playlist of titles you see on YouTube
that you like.

But now in the Creator Hooks Pro title generator, you can put in

Framework: The (Activity) The Ended (Entity)

​Hook score (

): +401

Why this works:

Negativity - This title is full of drama, which grabs the
audience's attention and interest.

Curiosity - The title opens a loop and makes you wonder what the
stunt was, but the thumbnail probably deserves most of the credit
here.

The thumbnail builds so much curiosity because it shows the
moment right before something dramatic happens.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about a
specific thing or event that ended something. Bonus points if
your thumbnail shows the tense moment right before that thing
happens.

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience would love to go from $0 to $1M

Beginners - "Going From $0" insinuates this video is for
beginners, which attracts the biggest, hungriest group in any
audience.

Time Frame - The time frame of "in 12 months" makes this video
more tangible and interesting. Plus, since it's relatively short,
it increases desire, too.

Curiosity - This ends by opening a loop and making you want to
know what he'd do.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience what you'd do
if you wanted to start from scratch and reach a big milestone in

Title: iOS 18.1 Settings To Turn OFF Now! (Important!)

Framework: [Entity] Settings To Turn OFF NOW! (Important)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hdvzl7mcrh8nol999bm/25h2hoh2mv5g62s3/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +2400

Why this works:

Negativity - This video warning viewers about turning settings
off has 3.4M views, while the video about turning settings on
from the same channel only has 471K views. Turning settings off
brings fear of what might happen if you don't turn them off,
instead of turning them on and thinking about the benefits you'd
get from them.

Curiosity - This title is vague and open-ended, which builds
curiosity about what the settings are and what could happen if
you don't turn them off.

Timeliness - iOS 18.1 was just released, so people are thinking
about this topic right now.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
settings they need to turn off for something they use.

* Instagram Settings To Turn OFF Now! (Important!)
* MacBook Air Settings To Turn OFF Now! (Important!)

Title: This Stupid TRICK Helped Me Play In Every Key On Guitar

Framework: This Stupid TRICK Helped Me (Achieve Goal)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hdvzl7mcrh8nol999bm/25h2hoh2mv5g62s3/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +3513

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience would love to be able to play
every key on guitar. And note that this isn't just about getting
better at guitar. It's a specific desire, and the word "Every"
gives it an almost epic feeling.

Curiosity - This builds curiosity in two ways:

* It opens a loop and makes you want to know what the trick is.
* It's counterintuitive that a "stupid" trick would help you do
something awesome.

Negativity - This isn't about a cool trick, it's about a "stupid"
trick, which grabs attention.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about a stupid
trick that helps them do something awesome.

Examples of this framework in action:

Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku790x74xi5hdvzl7mcrh8nol999bm/m2h7h5h84gr9vlim/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PUtFWFRndmJxeDZz
)
Title: 27 Years of No Bullsh*t Sales Advice in 16 Mins

Hook score: -90

Why this flopped: This title format is trending right now, so why
did it flop?

Well, the not-fun answer is sometimes videos flop for a variety
of complicated reasons and it's hard to identify exactly what
went wrong.

But we don't do not-fun answers here.

This section is to brainstorm ways we'd improve the packaging, so
let's do it.

One of my go-to moves in titles and thumbnails is to challenge
assumptions.

In this case, instead of "This Sh*t Is So Easy" in the thumbnail,
I'd use challenge common sales assumptions by saying something
like "Stop Following Up" or "Stop Using A Script".

You could also build curiosity with something like, "I Wish I
Knew This..."

Regarding the title, we could try to simplify it by shortening it
to, "27 Years of Sales Advice in 16 Mins".

If the topic and/or thumbnail are both great, you often don't
need a fancy title to get people to click.

Or we could change the angle and make it more specific by trying
something like, "Everything You Need To Know About Selling
Software In 2025".

*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

Btw, if you want to save more time and use a title generator that

).

*************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/08hwh9hd36v03kul/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PWNnd1RaR2ZlS1lv
)
(be sure to download images to see the thumbnails)

Title: 8 Biggest Scams In Gaming History

Framework: (Number) Biggest Scams In (Niche) History

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/8ghqhohlm6zem5sk/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +301

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Negativity - "Scams" brings drama and controversy that grabs the
audience's attention and makes them click.

Epic & Extreme - "Biggest" and "In Gaming History" makes this
video feel epic and extreme.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
biggest scams in your niche's history.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 8 Biggest Scams In NFL History
* 8 Biggest Scams In Wall Street History

*****
0-50K
*****

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/vqh3hrhpz9l2znag/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PUE0MEZyTkVzZ2hj
)
Title: How I Gained 50,000 Followers In 1 Month (9 Easy Steps)

Framework: How I [Achieved Goal] In [Short Time Frame] ([Number]
Easy Steps)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/8ghqhohlm6zem5sk/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +753

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience would love to get 50,000
followers in 1 month. Plus, "9 Easy Steps" adds to the desire by
making it sound easy.

Time Frame - The short time frame of "In 1 Month" also adds to
the desire and makes this video feel more tangible and
interesting.

Credibility - This isn't just a "how to" video, this is a "how I"
video, which makes it feel more credible.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how you
achieved a big goal of theirs in a relatively short time frame,
and give them easy steps so they can do the same.

Examples of this framework in action:

* How I Lost 15 Pounds In 1 Month (4 Easy Steps)
* How I Added 50 Yards To My Driver Swing In 1 Month (5 Easy
Steps)

**************************
Write Better Titles Faster
**************************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/m2h7h5h8d6vkd3am/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2dldC1jcmVhdG9yLWhvb2tzLXBybz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
)
The best way to write YouTube titles is to model other proven
titles.

And we just updated Creator Hooks Pro’s title generator so you
can now see the inspiration for the titles we’re generating to
make this even easier for you.

(You can see what it looks like in the “inspiration” popup in the
image above).

This is part of our mission to help you write better titles, save
time, and grow your channel.

).

"I got this title directly from Creator Hooks Pro's title

$25k in less than 2 weeks."

- Jeff Hampton, Hampton Law, 330K subscribers

)​

*********************
Ancient Enlightenment
*********************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/e0hph7h0836984i8/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PW8wQTlNNXdIQkE0
)
Title: An Ancient Roman Shipwreck May Explain the Universe

Framework: An (Obscure Entity) May Explain (Bigger Entity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/8ghqhohlm6zem5sk/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +1433

Why this works:

Curiosity - This builds curiosity because it's counterintuitive
that something seemingly meaningless, like an ancient Roman
shipwreck, can do something so meaningful, like explain the
universe.

Epic - Explaining the entire universe is pretty epic.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how something
meaningless or obscure can explain something so important.

Examples of this framework in action:

* An Ancient Chinese Proverb Explains The Modern Health Crisis
* An Ancient Mayan Calendar May Explain Climate Change

***************
These Not Those
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/z2hghnh3q2n9qnip/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PTQxZXBVM1hKYlRn
)
Title: 4 Nuts You Should Be Eating And 4 You Shouldn’t

Framework: (Number) (Entities) You Should Be (Activity) And
(Number) You Shouldn’t

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/8ghqhohlm6zem5sk/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +3399

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Desire & Negativity - This covers both ends of the spectrum with
nuts you should and shouldn't eat.

Curiosity - These two lists of nuts you should and shouldn't eat
do a great job of building curiosity because you've gotta click
to find out what the nuts are.

Note: I typically don't like using the word "and" in titles
because it dilutes the focus, but here's a great example of that
being a preference, not a rule.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about a list
of things they should and shouldn't be doing.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 4 Countries You Have To Visit And 4 That Are Overrated
* 4 LA Neighborhoods You Should Consider Moving To And 4 You
Shouldn’t

***************
Fleeing Florida
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/x0hph6hw5vo850c5/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PUZXME1iRWRXQmZR
)
Title: Why is EVERYONE Leaving Florida? (WHAT'S REALLY GOING ON?)

Framework: Why is EVERYONE (Negative Action)? (WHAT'S REALLY
GOING ON?)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/8ghqhohlm6zem5sk/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +16349

Why this works:

Negativity - This controversial topic does a great job of
grabbing the audience's attention.

Curiosity - This question builds curiosity, and "WHAT'S REALLY
GOING ON?" adds a bit of secrecy and conspiracy.

How you can use this framework: Ask why something bad and/or
dramatic is happening.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Why is EVERYONE Leaving TikTok? (WHAT'S REALLY GOING ON?)
* Why is EVERYONE Selling Their Teslas? (WHAT'S REALLY GOING ON?)

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt6hrg80gka5h29erlllsn/e0hph7h0836983h8/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PTd1NTd6VHNBaS1V
)
Title: A Scientist's Guide To Composting

Hook score: -75

Why this flopped: There are probably a few reasons that
contributed to this video flopping:

* It's not dramatic enough. Many of the best titles from this
channel have some drama, like "An Ancient Roman Shipwreck May
Explain the Universe" (4.5M views) or "The Doorway to the
Underworld is Growing and We Can't Stop It" (2.5M views).

* There's not much curiosity.
* The audience might not be looking for a guide to composting
from this channel.

We can't really change #1 — the video just doesn't have that much
drama.

And we can't change #3 — the video is already posted and the
audience wants what they want.

But we can change #2. Let's try to add some curiosity to this
title:

"How Your Trash Can Make The Planet Healthier"

"Stop Throwing Away Your Kitchen Trash - Do This Instead"

We can also try to increase the desire by making it more tangible
or calling out beginners:

"3 Steps To Make Perfect Compost In 60 Days"

"Everything You Need To Know To Start Composting As A Beginner"

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

titles, share your referral link below with them.

Why this works:

Time Frame - The time frame of "43 minutes" makes this video more
tangible and interesting.

Desire - This creator's audience wants to get better at
communication skills.

How you can use this framework: This is a great example of how to
package a compilation video. Put several videos together about a
topic your audience wants to learn about and say it's X minutes
straight of solid advice on that topic.

): +800

Timeliness - This video was published 9 days before Halloween.

Negativity - This title could've been, "The History of
Halloween," but adding some fear and controversy with
"Frightening Pagan" makes this title way more interesting.

Creator Hooks

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

).

***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/vqh3hrhpzdw7lkag/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PTAxQS05QkNFS2FJ
)
(be sure to download images to see the thumbnails)

Title: Can I Make a Movie in One Shot?

Framework: Can I (Achieve Goal) in One (Try)?

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/m2h7h5h8d74pv8bm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +373

Why this works:

Constraint - The constraint of making a movie in one shot makes
this video more challenging and interesting.

Curiosity - Asking if you can do something challenging is a
simple way to build curiosity.

How you can use this framework: Ask if you can do something
difficult in one try.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Can I Code a Whole Website In One Stream?
* Can I Learn Japanese in One Week?

****************
New Year New You
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/7qh7h8hormn7qzbz/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PXJsNjlWUWJzM2dB
)

Everything

Framework: The New Approach to (Activity) That Changes Everything

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/m2h7h5h8d74pv8bm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +649

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience is into personal branding.

Curiosity - This builds curiosity two ways:

* It makes you wonder what the new approach is.
* "Changes Everything" is open-ended and makes you wonder what
will change.

New Opportunity - People love new opportunities like new
approaches because they offer hope.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the new
approach to something they're trying to do that changes
everything.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The New Approach to Productivity That Changes Everything
* The New Approach to Gut Health That Changes Everything

******************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/6qheh8h7md9gzebo/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PWZjaTlNUTNWWl9J
)
Title: The Side of China The Media Won't Show You

Framework: The Side of (Polarizing Topic) The Media Won't Show
You

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/m2h7h5h8d74pv8bm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +1020

Why this works:

Conspiracy & Curiosity - "The Media Won't Show You" adds some
conspiracy and makes you feel like you're getting in on a secret.

And China is polarizing, which also grabs attention. If this was
"The Side of (Unheard of Country) The Media Won't Show You,"
nobody would care.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the side
of a polarizing topic the media won't show them.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The Side of the NFL the Media Won't Show You
* The Side of Electric Cards Elon Musk Won't Admit

************
Tax Reaction
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/58hvh7hmrz68qdc6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PUNZN2lrcHdWODBZ
)
Title: Tax Expert Breaks Down Kamala Harris's Tax Plan (FULL
DETAILS)

Framework: (Industry Professional) Breaks Down (Trending
Authority Figure’s) (Relevant Entity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/m2h7h5h8d74pv8bm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +2881

Why this works:

Timeliness - This video was published a few weeks before the
election and does a great job of riding the election's popularity
(and polarity).

Authority - Since this creator is a tax expert, he has authority
regarding tax plans, so you want to hear what he has to say about
this topic.

Negativity - The thumbnail makes it clear there's some
controversy in this video.

How you can use this framework: If you're an expert or
professional, break down a trending authority's plan for
something in your realm.

Examples of this framework in action:

* PGA Coach Breaks Down Trump's Golf Swing
* Ex-Nasa Engineer Breaks Down Elon Musk's Space Plan

***************
Speedy Studying
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/qvh8h7hr90k5zkcl/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PU1hTzF1Q2QtZ0xZ
)
Title: How to STUDY so FAST that it feels ILLEGAL😳

Framework: How to (Action or Goal) so FAST that it feels ILLEGAL😳

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/m2h7h5h8d74pv8bm/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +4072

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience wants to study fast.

Speed - Adding speed (in this case, "study so FAST") is a great
way to enhance your audience's desire and interest in your
video's topic.

Negativity - "feels ILLEGAL" adds a bit of controversy and an
edge to this video that makes it feel more exciting.

How you can use this framework: Show your audience how to do
something so fast that it feels illegal.

Examples of this framework in action:

* How to Get Jacked so FAST that it feels ILLEGAL😳
* How to Learn Guitar so FAST that it feels ILLEGAL

********************
A/B Test of the Week
********************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/92u9vnd90dtnhq8032ls9hz3vmd33aw/3ohphkh7enpl0wsr/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tLzEwMy15b3V0dWJlLXRpdGxlLWEtYi10ZXN0cz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
)
Suppose your video is about a topic people don't immediately
recognize or aren't necessarily excited about (even if it's cool
once they learn about it).

In that case, you might not want to include the exact topic in
your title.

Instead, you can zoom out and give it a simple, but extreme label
(like "Ireland's Creepiest Island").

This makes your title easier to understand and more exciting.

Title: What the Forest Taught Me About Gardening

Hook score: -77

Why this flopped: This title is a little bland and boring.

The video is about lazy gardening (aka gardening without watering
or weeding), and here are some of the previous titles she tried
(thanks, Viewstats Chrome extension):

* The Ultimate Lazy Garden, and What It Has to Teach Us
* Lazy Gardening on Steroids: 7 Lessons From the Forest
* The World's Laziest Garden, and What It Has to Teach Us
* The World's Laziest Garden (The Forest), and What It Has to
Teach Us
* The World's Laziest Garden! | FULL Backyard Forest Tour!
* The World's Laziest Garden! | Backyard Forest Tour!
* What the Forest Has to Teach Us About Gardening

It seems like she really only tried two angles: lazy gardening
and what the forest teaches us about gardening.

Here are a few ways we could mix it up:

We could specifically call out the main benefit of lazy
gardening:

"The Secret To Having A Garden You Don't Need To Water Or Weed"

We could zoom out, be a little vague, and just hint at a big
benefit:

"This Gardening Secret Changed My Life Forever"

Or we could add a hint of regret:

"I Wish I Knew THIS About Gardening 10 Years Ago"

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

)
(be sure to download images to see the thumbnails)

Title: Pro Chefs Blind Taste Test Every Box of Frozen Dumplings |
The Taste Panel | Epicurious

Framework: (Professionals) (Unbiased Test) Every
(Non-Professional Item)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5qu568o54ot7hv4wq5ob6h94dwl44sn/kkhmh6hl06rq8dul/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +419

Why this works:

Authority - “Pro Chefs” bring authority and credibility here. You
want to know what the pros have to say about these frozen
dumplings, which makes this video more interesting.

Credibility - A blind taste test makes this video feel more
credible, organic, and real.

Curiosity - There’s contrast between “Pro Chefs” and “Frozen
Dumplings”, which builds curiosity and makes this video more
interesting.

"Every" - The word “Every” brings a feeling of epicness and
completeness to this video. They didn’t just test a few boxes,
they tested “Every”.

How you can use this framework: Get professionals to do an
unbiased test on cheap or unprofessional things in your niche.

Examples of this framework in action:

* College Professors Grade Real Student vs. AI Papers
* Pro Runners Blind Test Every Running Shoe Brand

*************

(

): +460

Why this works:

Curiosity - This builds curiosity two ways:

* There’s a bit of contrast between “smallest” and “full frame”.
* It makes you want to know what camera this is.

Extreme - “Smallest” and “You’ve Ever Seen” both make this title
extreme and unique.

Desire - This creator’s audience likes small full frame cameras.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about an
extreme, unique, counterintuitive product they’d be interested
in.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The Loudest Silent Disco In The World
* The Biggest Miniature Dog Is The Perfect Pet

): +511

Why this works:

Negativity - “Red Flags” does a great job at grabbing attention.
Nobody wants to do these common behaviors and accidentally get in
trouble.

Curiosity - This builds curiosity two ways:

* It’s counterintuitive that “common behaviors” would be “major
red flags”.
* This does a good job of opening a loop and making you wonder
what these common behaviors are.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about common
things that are major red flags.

Examples of this framework in action:

* These Common Behaviors Are MAJOR Dating Red Flags
* These Popular Trends Are MAJOR Recession Red Flags
