): +1073

Why this works:

Trending - Tesla Cybertrucks are still trending right now, which
brings a lot of attention to this title.

Negativity - “It Scares the Crap Out of Me” brings some fear
here.

Curiosity - “It Scares the Crap Out of Me” also builds curiosity
because it’s so vague and makes you want to know why it scares
him so much.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience that you
finally got a trending product, but it scares the crap out of
you.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I Finally Got Apple Vision Pro and It Scares the Crap Out of Me
* I Just Tried ChatGPT’s Newest Model and It Scares the Crap Out

)

Object) in (Short Time Frame)

): +3271

Why this works:

Desire - This creator’s audience loves to turn regular things in
spectacular things.

Time Frame - The short time frame of “in 10 minutes” adds to that
desire because it makes it feel tangible and accomplishable.

Curiosity - The contrast between “handkerchief” and “spectacular
gift” builds curiosity and interest.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how they can
turn something mundane into something spectacular in a short
period of time.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Turn a Blog Post Into a Viral Video in 10 Minutes
* Turn Leftovers Into a Spectacular Meal in 10 Minutes

)
Title: These 3 Dressings Will Upgrade Any Salad | Epicurious 101

Hook score: -77

Why this flopped: This title isn't bad. It's straightforward and
benefit-driven, but apparently not spicy enough (this video got
67K views, but the channel averages about 257K).

Here are a few ways we could mix it up:

We could add a constraint:

"The Only 3 Salad Dressings You Need"

We could try to hype it up more:

"These 3 Salad Dressings Will Change Your Life"

Or we could make it a bit more tangible and add an even crazier
benefit:

"3 Home-Made Salad Dressings To Make Him Fall In Love With You"

Of course, there's always the fact that this audience just might
not be into salad dressings, but that's whole different topic.

https://click.convertkit-mail.com/d0ug29og0oh0h42g7w8tmhz4r6544cl/qvh8h7hrmvle9gsl/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +439

Why this works:

Epic - This is a creative, epic way to say you found a great
product.

Curiosity - This builds curiosity because it makes you want to
know more about the product and what it is.

Desire - This leverages desire two ways:

* This creator's audience loves home gym equipment.
* "Budget" increases the desire because it sounds more
affordable.

"Budget" also attracts a large audience because it's about
affordable equipment. If the video was about a $10,000 product,
this topic would have a lot less of a potential audience.

Note: the company that owns this product is spending a lot of
money on advertising. This is a popular product that many people
are probably wondering about, which probably also contributed to
the higher views. How do I know this? Their Instagram ads got me.
I bought it and I love it.

How you can use this framework: Review a cool, popular product
and call it the new KING (or QUEEN) of its category.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I think I found the new KING of Budget Camping Tents
* I think I found the new KING of Email Newsletter Platforms!

): +479

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience would love to keep their garages
comfy year-round. Plus, "easy" enhances the audience's desire for
these upgrades.

Curiosity - This does a great job at opening a loop because it
says there are two upgrades, but doesn't specify what they are,
so you've gotta click to find out.

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about two easy
upgrades that can help them achieve a goal.

Examples of this framework in action:

* These 2 Easy Upgrades Keep Your Guitar Sounding Amazing
* These 2 Easy Changes Make Your MacBook Air Faster

): +537

Why this works:

Desire - This title leverages desire two ways:

* This creator's audience wants mixing advice
* They're getting a lot in a little (10 years in just 10
minutes).

Credibility - Sharing how many years of experience you have (if
it's significant) does a great job at building credibility.

Time Frame - People love time frames, and this title has two of
them. "10 Years" builds credibility and "10 minutes" increases
the desire and lets you know exactly what you're getting in this
video.

How you can use this framework: Condense your many years of
experience into a short time frame for your audience.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 10 Years of Farming Experience in 10 Minutes
* 10 Years of Photography Advice in 10 Minutes

): +645

Why this works:

Credibility - This starts with a simple statement showing why
people should listen to him.

Specific Audience - If you're in your 20s, you feel like this
video was made specifically for you, so you're more likely to
watch.

How you can use this framework: State your experience and then
call out a specific audience you can help. Usually, this audience
is your past self when you were just getting started.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I Have 1,000,000 YouTube Subs. If You're A Beginner, Watch This
* I'm a Mom of 5. If You're Having Your First Kid, Watch This

old) retirees!

Group)

): +26750

Why this works:

Negativity - Regrets make great video topics because they're so
tangible and emotional. Nobody wants to have regrets.

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Credibility - Since these are regrets from elderly retirees who
have been where the audience is planning on going, these regrets
feel more credible.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the top
regrets of people who have achieved what your audience is trying
to achieve.

Examples of this framework in action:

* INVESTING REGRETS: Top 5 regrets from Wall Street Investors
* COLLEGE REGRETS: Top 5 regrets from college graduates

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/d0ug29og0oh0h42g7w8tmhz4r6544cl/reh8hoh0l7okgqa2/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PWt0OWxpV0pmYTZj
)
Title: Energy Coach Shares 3 Secrets to a Long and Happy Life

Hook score: -98

Why this flopped: This video makes two big mistakes:

* It's a different video format from the rest of the channel.
This is a clip from Sky News, not a talking head video like all
the other videos. I'd guess that as soon as people click on it
and see it's a news segment, they're clicking off the video.
* The title and thumbnail feel like they're coming from a news
channel. They feel stuffy and cheesy, whereas his other videos
(you can see the "I'm 40" video above as an example) feel more
natural and organic. The title isn't even that bad, but when
paired with that newsy screenshot for the thumbnail, it instantly
feels more sleazy.

To avoid a flop like this, make your thumbnails, titles, and
videos in a consistent format.

I'm assuming this creator wanted to build some authority by
showing he was on the news. If it were me and I wanted to do
this, I'd probably just mention it in a video that had the same
packaging and content style as my other videos, as opposed to
sharing the whole clip.

Body:
*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

Btw, if you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles ever featured in Creator Hooks, check out
Creator Hooks Pro (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hglexk2fmhrqmdlqqa3/7qh7h8ho7xn8zqiz/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2NyZWF0b3Job29rcy1wcm8_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2bw==
).

***************
The Real Master
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hglexk2fmhrqmdlqqa3/z2hghnh3vml7wxup/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PTlINllIM3ZBQ3pj
)
(be sure to download images to see the thumbnails)

Title: Professional Engineer versus the FINAL LEVEL of Poly
Bridge 3…

Framework: (Authority Figure) versus (Game or Alternative
Challenge)…

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hglexk2fmhrqmdlqqa3/x0hph6hw64qz3vs5/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +462

Why this works:

Authority - This game is about building bridges, so how a
Professional Engineer plays it is interesting because they do
this in real life for a living.

Curiosity - X vs. Y videos like this build curiosity because
there's conflict and you want to know what will happen.

How you can use this framework: Show your audience how a
professional in a field compares to a game or something "normal"
people do.

Examples of this framework in action:

* NBA Player versus NBA 2K Champion...
* Google Engineer versus ChatGPT Coding Challenge

*********************
Theory of Constraints
*********************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hglexk2fmhrqmdlqqa3/6qheh8h7g39womco/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PUg5TnItS3JZN3hR
)
Title: How to Run Fast at a Low Heart Rate

Framework: How to (Achieve Goal) (With Constraint)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvu2k852d5a5hglexk2fmhrqmdlqqa3/x0hph6hw64qz3vs5/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +470

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience would love to run fast at a low
heart rate. Plus, running at a low heart rate (Zone 2, for the
running nerds) is a hot trend right now.

Constraint - Running fast is easy, but the constraint of doing it
at a low heart rate makes it much more difficult. This increases
the desire and the intrigue of this video.

Curiosity - There's also a bit of counterintuitiveness here
because most people would assume if you're running fast you don't
have a low heart rate.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience how to achieve
a goal with a constraint or with little effort.

Examples of this framework in action:

* How to Grow On LinkedIn By Publishing Less
* How to Visit The World's Most Beautiful Countries For Free

they found.

Credibility - This isn't just conjecture. Since they actually put
7 Uber drivers in a room it makes this video feel way more
believable.

results and show your audience what you discovered.

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

Btw, if you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles ever featured in Creator Hooks, check out

).

***************
Handsome Habits
***************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/x0hph6hw62vqp0s5/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PWdoMDRzelVXNEJz
)
(be sure to download images to see the thumbnails)

Title: 5 Habits That Instantly Boost Your Attractiveness

Framework: ​​5 Habits That Instantly (Achieve Goal)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/6qheh8h7gr895gio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +328

Why this works:

List - Lists make videos feel more tangible (you know exactly
what the video will be about) and they add some curiosity.

Desire - This creator's audience would love to boost their
attractiveness. Plus, people love speed, so "instantly" adds to
this desire.

"Habits" - Habits is a power word that works often in channels
that help people become better at something.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the 5
habits that help them instantly achieve a goal.

Examples of this framework in action:

* 5 Habits That Instantly Boost Your Productivity
* 5 Habits That Instantly Make Your Heart Healthier

*********
Solo Dolo
*********

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/kkhmh6hlqw0x50sl/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PUVfZW04SFoyWlgw
)
Title: The One-Man-Show Making & Delivering NYC’s Hottest
Sandwiches | On The Line | Bon Appétit

Framework: The (Constraint) (Impressive Activity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/6qheh8h7gr895gio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +615

Why this works:

Constraint - The constraint of "One-Man-Show" does two things
here:

* It builds curiosity. How can just one man make and deliver
NYC's hottest sandwiches?
* It increases desire and relatability. If this one man can do
it, maybe I can too?

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about an
entity with a constraint doing something impressive.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The One-Man-Band Making TikTok's Most Popular Music
* The One-Man-Agency Taking Over LA's Real Estate Market

)​

Now you can:

).

)​
​

**************
Marine Mystery
**************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/25h2hoh2z9pm8mi3/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PVpyeHk1a1lVSDd3
)
Title: This Sea Is the Most Mysterious in the World

Framework: This (Entity) Is the Most Mysterious in the World

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/6qheh8h7gr895gio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +764

Why this works:

Curiosity - "Mysterious" is a simple, but great way to build
curiosity.

Epic - "Most Mysterious in the World" makes this video feel
extreme and epic, which makes it way more interesting.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the most
mysterious thing in the world related to your niche.

Examples of this framework in action:

* This Hiking Trail Is the Most Mysterious in the World
* This Abandoned Building Is the Most Mysterious in the World

***********************
Dressing Dos and Don'ts
***********************

(

)
Title: French Dressing Rules EVERYONE Should Learn Once And For
ALL

Framework: (Authority) (Activity) Rules EVERYONE Should Learn
Once And For ALL

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/6qheh8h7gr895gio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +849

Why this works:

Authority - The French are known for being excellent dressers, so
this title leverages their authority.

Desire - This creator's audience wants to dress better and this
title essentially promises they will learn how to do that.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about an
authority group's rules everyone should learn.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Wall Street Investing Rules EVERYONE Should Learn Once And For
ALL
* Hollywood Charisma Rules EVERYONE Should Know

*********
Coming Up
*********

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/3ohphkh7lm5pr6hr/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PWlRenNxZzR3cHhV
)
Title: Upcoming Action Sequels You Had No Idea Were Being Made

Framework: Upcoming (Entities) You Had No Idea Were (Activity)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/6qheh8h7gr895gio/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +1967

Why this works:

Desire - This creator's audience likes action sequels and
everybody likes to hear news about upcoming things they like.

Curiosity - "You Had No Idea Were Being Made" makes you feel like
you're getting in on a secret.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about upcoming
things they had no idea were happening.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Upcoming YouTube Algorithm Changes You Had No Idea Were
Happening
* Upcoming iPhone 16 Pro Updates You Had No Idea Were Being Made

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8ukorlkzltrhxqk74lcghvlpo8llh9/48hvhehreldx9pix/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PVlVcjJhc21HVEtV
)
Title: Is AI Making The Dating World Harder to Date?

Hook score: -89

Why this flopped: There are two big problems with this title.

The first and biggest problem is that this channel's audience
doesn't seem to be interested in this topic.

In the last 5 months, this is the only video about AI.

(I do love trying out new topics to try to find new
opportunities, but sometimes it just doesn't work out!)

To avoid this problem, when you're evaluating potential ideas for
your channel one of the best questions to ask yourself is if it
has worked on your channel before.

The next problem is that it's a weak question.

Bold, confident, opinionated statements often work better as
YouTube titles than questions.

People are watching this channel to learn, and this question
doesn't really tell me I'm going to learn anything.

Plus, I already know the answer because it's a leading question
and because of the expressions in the thumbnail.

To avoid this problem, write your titles as bold, opinionated
statements.

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

titles, share your referral link below with them.

), and then when you go to the YouTube home page you'll see this
little AI icon below each video:

​
Click this icon to turn any video into ideas specifically for
your channel.

And here are 3 tips to get the most out of it:

* Make sure your topics & keywords are updated in your profile (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/xmuedmre8rt3u4o67oi5h2lr5kllhn/m2h7h5h8vz9o8qtm/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS9ob21lP2xjdGc9MmV6bW9lNm8mdGFiPWFjY291bnQ=

Body:
*************
Creator Hooks
*************

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you
write such great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you
write great titles and save time.

Btw, if you want to save more time and use a title generator that
uses all the titles ever featured in Creator Hooks, check out
Creator Hooks Pro (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/9qhzhnhpmd08p6f9/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2NyZWF0b3Job29rcy1wcm8_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2bw==
).

*************
Refund Review
*************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/3ohphkh7l3087rsr/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PS02bWtVSFFqLWZj
)
(be sure to download images to see the thumbnails)

Title: I Sold My $100,000 Cybertruck After 50 Days

Framework: I Sold My (Expensive, Cool Object) After 50 Days

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +392

Why this works:

Curiosity - This builds curiosity two ways:

* It opens a loop and makes you wonder why he sold his
Cybertruck.
* It’s a bit counterintuitive. Cyber trucks just got released,
they’re supposed to be cool, and he spent a lot of money on it…
why would he sell it?

Negativity - Selling a Cybertruck so early after buying it hints
at some drama and something wrong with it.

Time Frame - The short time frame of 50 days adds to the drama
here because it provides tangible proof he only kept this truck
for a short time, so something must have been off.

Timeliness - Cybertrucks are still trending a bit right now, so
this topic gets extra attention.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience why you sold
or moved on from something trending, expensive, desirable, and
exciting.

Examples of this framework in action:

* I Sold My $12,000 Mac Pro After 50 Days
* I Quit My $500,000 Google Engineering Job After 50 Days

****************
Lucratively Lazy
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/48hvhehremv3rnbx/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PVYtNTlUcnpNVnd3
)
Title: The Laziest AI Side Hustle to Make Money Online in 2024

Framework: The Laziest (Trending Opportunity) to (Achieve Goal)
in (Current Year)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +409

Why this works:

Desire - This leverages desire 3 ways.

* This creator’s audience wants to make money online.
* They’re excited about side hustles.
* It’s about “lazy” side hustles. Laziness enhances the desire
because it makes it seem like it’s going to be easy.

I’ve seen “lazy” work several times on YouTube. I’ve also seen it
flop a few times, but I think it’s an interesting angle worth
exploring.

Timeliness - This leverages timeliness two ways:

* It uses in the current year.
* AI is still an exciting, trending topic.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the
laziest opportunities or ways to achieve a goal this year.

Examples of this framework in action:

* The Laziest Keto Recipes To Lose Weight In 2025
* The Laziest AI Hacks To Land Your Dream Job in 2025

**************************************************
Introducing The New Creator Hooks Chrome Extension
**************************************************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/wnh2hghwpqndwos7/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS90aXRsZS1yZW1peGVyP2xjdGc9MmV6bW9lNm8=
)​
The best way to come up with YouTube video ideas is to see what
works for other channels and remix that idea for your channel.

Now you can do this automatically with the new Creator Hooks
Chrome extension!

You can get it here for free:
https://pro.creatorhooks.com/title-remixer (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/wnh2hghwpqndwos7/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS90aXRsZS1yZW1peGVyP2xjdGc9MmV6bW9lNm8=
)​

P.S. ​Salvatore got a 1 of 10 using this!

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/wnh2hghwpqndwos7/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS90aXRsZS1yZW1peGVyP2xjdGc9MmV6bW9lNm8=
)​
​

******************
The Great Showdown
******************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/reh8hoh0rm4p0qa2/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PTVhTGJubWpheFFj
)
Title: Women's reaction to unattractive VS handsome men
[Comparison]

Framework: (Authority Figure)’s reaction to (Undesirable) VS
(Desirable Trait) (Entity) [Comparison]

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +461

Why this works:

Curiosity - There’s contrast here (unattractive vs. handsome) and
it opens a loop because you want to see how the women will react.

Authority - When it comes to unattractive vs handsome men, women
are an authority and people whose opinion men value.

How you can use this framework: Show your audience how someone
with a valuable opinion reacts to two opposite things.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Farmer’s reaction to Lab-Grown VS Real Food [Comparison]
* Musician’s reaction to AI vs. real music

*************
Underdog Tips
*************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/8ghqhohlvoz8lohk/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PUJwdkJOVUJsWHdV
)
Title: Best Updates to Sell an Older Home (Without BREAKING the
Bank!)

Framework: Best [Actions] to [Activity] a [Underdog Entity]
(Without [Biggest Objection]!)

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +520

Why this works:

Desire - This creator’s audience would love to sell their older
home without spending a ton of money.

Refute Objection - Many people assume these updates are going to
cost a lot of money, but “(Without BREAKING the Bank!)” gets rid
of that objection and makes this video more interesting.

Negativity - This is about selling older homes, not new, fancy
homes. Older homes may be harder to sell, so this targets a
specific group of people with a pain point.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about the best
things they can do to achieve a hard goal without a big excuse
they likely have.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Best Updates to Sell a Dying Business (Without BREAKING the
Bank!)
* Best Changes to Fix a Horrible Diet (Without Wasting Hours
Cooking!)

************
Deadly Drama
************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/m2h7h5h8p3vx8wam/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PXBkZmtVckxjaE9n
)
Title: Famous atheists last words before dying..

Framework: Famous (Contrarian Figure)’s last (Actions) before
(Negative Event)..

​Hook score (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv
): +2034

Why this works:

Negativity - A big, negative event like dying increases the
significance of somebody’s last actions and words.

Plus, this is from a Christian channel, so the fact that this is
an atheist’s last words adds to the drama.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you want to know what
their last words are.

How you can use this framework: Tell your audience about a
contrarian person’s famous last words or actions before something
bad happened.

Examples of this framework in action:

* Famous scientist’s last words before discovering c*vid..
* Jeff Bezos’ last words before selling Amazon..

****************
Flop of the Week
****************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/7qh7h8ho79qeolfz/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PXZPZ2NZT2dsR1Jn
)
Title: This Guy BROKE The YouTube Algorithm - Here’s What You can
Learn From Him

Hook score: -82

Why this flopped: This video is great, but the title focuses on
the wrong thing.

Most of the titles on this channel focus on benefits for the
audience as listicles or personal stories:

* "How I Made a Faceless YouTube Channel Using AI ($10K/Month
Revenue)"

* "The Laziest AI Side Hustle to Make Money Online in 2024"

And all of the thumbnails have the creator's face in them.

But this packaging focuses on a guy the audience doesn't
necessarily know.

At first I thought this video was a podcast or testimonial.

Neither of these things are in line with what works on this
channel, so that's probably the biggest reason why this flopped.

But then I watched the video and I realized it's actually about a
tactic that highlights how the YouTube algorithm worked.

So instead of focusing the title on the guy who broke the
algorithm, it probably would've been smarter to focus the title
on the tactic and/or the benefits the viewer would get after
using the tactic.

Here are two examples:

* This Simple Trick Exposed The YouTube Algorithm
* 3 Things Every YouTuber Needs To Know to About The Algorithm In
2025

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

If you know a fellow creator who needs help with writing better
titles, share your referral link below with them.

- Jake

‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Creator Hooks

I've asked some of the best creators on YouTube, “How do you write such
great titles?”

And they've all said the same thing: “I just model what works.”

So this email will show you 5 videos worth modeling to help you write great
titles and save time.

Btw, if you want to save more time and use a title generator that uses all
the titles ever featured in Creator Hooks, check out *Creator Hooks Pro*
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/9qhzhnhpmd08p6f9/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2NyZWF0b3Job29rcy1wcm8_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2bw==>
.
Refund Review
[image: sold cybertruck thumbnail]
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/3ohphkh7l3087rsr/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PS02bWtVSFFqLWZj>

*(be sure to download images to see the thumbnails)*

*Title:* I Sold My $100,000 Cybertruck After 50 Days

*Framework:* I Sold My (Expensive, Cool Object) After 50 Days

*Hook score*
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv>
*:* +392

*Why this works: *

Curiosity - This builds curiosity two ways:

   1. It opens a loop and makes you wonder why he sold his Cybertruck.
   2. It’s a bit counterintuitive. Cyber trucks just got released, they’re
   supposed to be cool, and he spent a lot of money on it… why would he sell
   it?

Negativity - Selling a Cybertruck so early after buying it hints at some
drama and something wrong with it.

Time Frame - The short time frame of 50 days adds to the drama here because
it provides tangible proof he only kept this truck for a short time, so
something must have been off.

Timeliness - Cybertrucks are still trending a bit right now, so this topic
gets extra attention.

*How you can use this framework:* Tell your audience why you sold or moved
on from something trending, expensive, desirable, and exciting.

*Examples of this framework in action:*

   - I Sold My $12,000 Mac Pro After 50 Days
   - I Quit My $500,000 Google Engineering Job After 50 Days

Lucratively Lazy
[image: lazy ai side hustle thumbnail]
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/48hvhehremv3rnbx/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PVYtNTlUcnpNVnd3>

*Title:* The Laziest AI Side Hustle to Make Money Online in 2024

*Framework: *The Laziest (Trending Opportunity) to (Achieve Goal) in
(Current Year)

*Hook score*
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv>
*:* +409

*Why this works:*

Desire - This leverages desire 3 ways.

   1. This creator’s audience wants to make money online.
   2. They’re excited about side hustles.
   3. It’s about “lazy” side hustles. Laziness enhances the desire because
   it makes it seem like it’s going to be easy.

I’ve seen “lazy” work several times on YouTube. I’ve also seen it flop a
few times, but I think it’s an interesting angle worth exploring.

Timeliness - This leverages timeliness two ways:

   1. It uses in the current year.
   2. AI is still an exciting, trending topic.

*How you can use this framework:* Tell your audience about the laziest
opportunities or ways to achieve a goal this year.

*Examples of this framework in action:*

   - The Laziest Keto Recipes To Lose Weight In 2025
   - The Laziest AI Hacks To Land Your Dream Job in 2025

*Introducing The New Creator Hooks Chrome Extension*
[image: title remixer]
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/wnh2hghwpqndwos7/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS90aXRsZS1yZW1peGVyP2xjdGc9MmV6bW9lNm8=>

The best way to come up with YouTube video ideas is to see what works for
other channels and remix that idea for your channel.

Now you can do this automatically with the new Creator Hooks Chrome
extension!

You can get it here for free: *https://pro.creatorhooks.com/title-remixer*
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/wnh2hghwpqndwos7/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS90aXRsZS1yZW1peGVyP2xjdGc9MmV6bW9lNm8=>

P.S. Salvatore got a 1 of 10 using this!
[image: 1 of 10 from chrome extension]
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/wnh2hghwpqndwos7/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm8uY3JlYXRvcmhvb2tzLmNvbS90aXRsZS1yZW1peGVyP2xjdGc9MmV6bW9lNm8=>
The Great Showdown
[image: women's reaction thumbnail]
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/reh8hoh0rm4p0qa2/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PTVhTGJubWpheFFj>

*Title:* Women's reaction to unattractive VS handsome men [Comparison]

*Framework: *(Authority Figure)’s reaction to (Undesirable) VS (Desirable
Trait) (Entity) [Comparison]

*Hook score*
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv>
*:* +461

*Why this works:*

Curiosity - There’s contrast here (unattractive vs. handsome) and it opens
a loop because you want to see how the women will react.

Authority - When it comes to unattractive vs handsome men, women are an
authority and people whose opinion men value.

*How you can use this framework:* Show your audience how someone with a
valuable opinion reacts to two opposite things.

*Examples of this framework in action:*

   - Farmer’s reaction to Lab-Grown VS Real Food [Comparison]
   - Musician’s reaction to AI vs. real music

Underdog Tips
[image: older home updates thumbnail]
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/8ghqhohlvoz8lohk/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PUJwdkJOVUJsWHdV>

*Title:* Best Updates to Sell an Older Home (Without BREAKING the Bank!)

*Framework: *Best [Actions] to [Activity] a [Underdog Entity] (Without
[Biggest Objection]!)

*Hook score*
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv>
*:* +520

*Why this works:*

Desire - This creator’s audience would love to sell their older home
without spending a ton of money.

Refute Objection - Many people assume these updates are going to cost a lot
of money, but “(Without BREAKING the Bank!)” gets rid of that objection and
makes this video more interesting.

Negativity - This is about selling older homes, not new, fancy homes. Older
homes may be harder to sell, so this targets a specific group of people
with a pain point.

*How you can use this framework:* Tell your audience about the best things
they can do to achieve a hard goal without a big excuse they likely have.

*Examples of this framework in action:*

   - Best Updates to Sell a Dying Business (Without BREAKING the Bank!)
   - Best Changes to Fix a Horrible Diet (Without Wasting Hours Cooking!)

Deadly Drama
[image: atheists words thumbnail]
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/m2h7h5h8p3vx8wam/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PXBkZmtVckxjaE9n>

*Title:* Famous atheists last words before dying..

*Framework: *Famous (Contrarian Figure)’s last (Actions) before (Negative
Event)..

*Hook score*
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/n2hohvh3pvm435a6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdG9yaG9va3MuY29tL2hvb2stc2NvcmUtZXhwbGFpbmVkLz9sY3RnPTJlem1vZTZv>
*:* +2034

*Why this works:*

Negativity - A big, negative event like dying increases the significance of
somebody’s last actions and words.

Plus, this is from a Christian channel, so the fact that this is an
atheist’s last words adds to the drama.

Curiosity - This opens a loop and makes you want to know what their last
words are.

*How you can use this framework:* Tell your audience about a contrarian
person’s famous last words or actions before something bad happened.

*Examples of this framework in action:*

   - Famous scientist’s last words before discovering c*vid..
   - Jeff Bezos’ last words before selling Amazon..

Flop of the Week
[image: youtube algorithm thumbnail]
<https://click.convertkit-mail.com/e5uo8xmo9mi7hpdp6els8h82ekw22bl/7qh7h8ho79qeolfz/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_bGN0Zz0yZXptb2U2byZ2PXZPZ2NZT2dsR1Jn>

*Title:* This Guy BROKE The YouTube Algorithm - Here’s What You can Learn
From Him

*Hook score:* -82

*Why this flopped: *This video is great, but the title focuses on the wrong
thing.

Most of the titles on this channel focus on benefits for the audience as
listicles or personal stories:

   - "How I Made a Faceless YouTube Channel Using AI ($10K/Month Revenue)"
   - "The Laziest AI Side Hustle to Make Money Online in 2024"

And all of the thumbnails have the creator's face in them.

But this packaging focuses on a guy the audience doesn't necessarily know.

At first I thought this video was a podcast or testimonial.

Neither of these things are in line with what works on this channel, so
that's probably the biggest reason why this flopped.

But then I watched the video and I realized it's actually about a tactic
that highlights how the YouTube algorithm worked.

So instead of focusing the title on the guy who broke the algorithm, it
probably would've been smarter to focus the title on the tactic and/or the
benefits the viewer would get after using the tactic.

Here are two examples:

   - This Simple Trick Exposed The YouTube Algorithm
   - 3 Things Every YouTuber Needs To Know to About The Algorithm In 2025

Alright, that wraps up this week’s Creator Hooks!

Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoyed this week's edition.

If you know a fellow creator who needs help with writing better titles,
share your referral link below with them.

- Jake

)

.

Subject: The easiest way to write better YouTube titles
Preview:
A few years ago I landed my dream job as the marketing manager at
a fishing company.

Part of my job was managing our YouTube channel, but there was
one problem: it was my first time running a You
Body:
A few years ago I landed my dream job as the marketing manager at
a fishing company.

Part of my job was managing our YouTube channel, but there was
one problem: it was my first time running a YouTube channel and I
was terrible at writing titles.

I almost got fired because I was so bad and, on YouTube, a
video’s title is so important.

But then I learned the secret: you don’t need to be good at
writing titles, you just need to model successful YouTube videos.

Here’s how it works: I would find a video that did well in
another industry, like finance.

Let’s say the title was, “10 Best Credit Cards in 2024.” I would
model that idea for our fishing channel and make a video about
“10 Best Trout Lures in 2024.”

It worked so well that not only did I save my job, but our
channel started taking off.

After a few years of this working for our fishing channel, I had
a hunch it would work for other channels, so I started Creator
Hooks.

As it turns out, it does work!

​

​
I'm sharing my story and these screenshots to encourage you that
you can get better at coming up with video ideas, write great
titles, and grow your channel.

I hope you enjoy the Creator Hooks newsletter and I'm thankful
you're here.

- Jake

​
